OperatorId.description: ID of operator currently logged onto the asset / telemetry device.

FacilityCode.description: ID embedded in operator access card, normally referred to as site or facility code. Helps to determine which operator is currently logged onto the asset / telemetry device.

AccessLevel.description: Indicates level of telemetry system access to the Truck / Asset.

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: No access is defined for this operator. For example the operator is yet to login to the system.

oneOf.title: Operator
oneOf.description: Asset / Truck can be operated as normal.

oneOf.title: Technician
oneOf.description: A level above Operator Access. Technician can unlock an Asset / Truck tagged out of service and may have further privileges above Operator Access, allowing them to perform work on a Truck/Asset unimpeded.

oneOf.title: Supervisor
oneOf.description: A level above Operator access. Supervisor can unlock an Asset / Truck tagged out of service and may have different privileges to Technician Access.

oneOf.title: RME
oneOf.description: Reliability Maintenance Engineer Access. A level above Operator access. Supervisor can unlock an Asset / Truck tagged out of service and may have further privileges above Technician and/or Supervisor Access.

PerformanceMode.description: Indicates the performance mode of the operator logged into the telemetry system. Truck Speed and Hoist Speed may be reduced in this mode when the truck limit feature is enabled.

oneOf.title: No Mode
oneOf.description: No performance mode is defined for this operator. For example the operator is yet to login to the system.

oneOf.title: Novice
oneOf.description: Novice performance mode. Truck Speed and Hoist Speed may be reduced in this mode when the truck limit feature is enabled.

oneOf.title: Intermediate
oneOf.description: Intermediate performance mode. Truck Speed and Hoist Speed may be reduced in this mode when the truck limit feature is enabled.

oneOf.title: Advanced
oneOf.description: Advanced performance mode. Truck Speed and Hoist Speed may be reduced in this mode when the truck limit feature is enabled.

CurrentDateTime.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Current device date and time in UTC.

GpsLat.title: GPS Latitude
GpsLat.description: Units: 10^-7 deg/bit. Indicates Latitude of the last / current GPS position. Sign indicates cardinal. Negative latitude indicates South. Positive indicates North.

GpsLong.title: GPS Longitude
GpsLong.description: Units: 10^-7 deg/bit. Indicates Longitude of the last / current GPS position. Sign indicates cardinal. Negative Longitude indicates West. Positive indicates East.

GpsFixDT.title: GPS Fix Date Time
GpsFixDT.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates Date and Time of last / current GPS position fix in UTC.

GpsFixType.description: Indicates type of the current GPS position fix. Fix type gives some indication of position accuracy. If no fix is available, fix type may indicate Antenna status.

GpsBearing.description: Units: Decimal Degrees. Indicates instantaneous Bearing at last / current GPS position.

GpsSpeed.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Indicates instantaneous Speed at last / current GPS position, calculated from GPS.

GpsHDOP.description: Units: HDOP x 10. Indicates the horizontal dilution of precision for the last / current GPS position

GpsAltitude.description: Units: Metres. Indicates altitude above sea level of last / current GPS position

GpsSatCount.title: GPS Satellites Count
GpsSatCount.description: Units: Count. Indicates number of satellites used to determine last / current GPS position

AssetId.description: The unique serial number of the Asset/Truck connected to the telemetry device

AssetBuildId.description: The unique build identification number of the Asset/Truck. Sometimes referred to as Work Unit Number. This number can be used to link a particular customer order to a Asset/Truck Serial Number.

AssetStatus.description: Indicates current 'In Use' status of the Asset connected to the telemetry device

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: Current status of the Asset is unknown.

oneOf.title: Active
oneOf.description: Asset is currently in operation.

oneOf.title: Available
oneOf.description: Asset is currently NOT in use but is ready for use.

oneOf.title: Locked
oneOf.description: Asset is currently locked out and cannot be used until a Technician/Supervisor/RME verifies asset is operational.

oneOf.title: LockedToBeVerified
oneOf.description: Asset is currently locked out awaiting review from onsite Technician/Supervisor/RME.

oneOf.title: LockedVerified
oneOf.description: Asset is currently locked out and an onsite Technician/Supervisor/RME has verified the Asset is not operational and requires service/repair.

oneOf.title: OutOfService
oneOf.description: Asset is currently out of service, awaiting service/repair.

ServiceHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Lifetime asset usage meter that the asset is serviced against.

EngineRunTimeMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Lifetime hour meter of time asset has had its engine running.

HydraulicHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Lifetime hour meter of asset's hydraulics usage.

TractionHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Lifetime hour meter of asset's drive motor usage.

Odometer.description: Units: Metres. Sum of distance asset has traveled over it's lifetime.

MonitoredDurationHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Sum of asset service hours that the telemetry module has spent monitoring asset.

ContainerCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

LadenHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Duration asset spent laden (carrying a load) over its lifetime.

UnladenHourMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Duration asset spent on but unladen over its lifetime.

FuelUsedMeter.description: Units: 0.5 Litres. Sum of amount of fuel asset has consumed over its lifetime.

IdleFuelUsedMeter.description: Units: 0.5 Litres. Sum of amount of fuel asset has consumed while idle over its lifetime.

ReachSecureMeter.description: Units: Seconds. Lifetime asset usage meter that is incremented differently to the service meter.

Speed.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Current Speed of asset.

Speed_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use raw speed when Asset/Truck Speed cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

LoadWeight.description: Units: Kg. Current Weight of asset's load.

LoadWeight_Raw.description: Units: Kg. Use raw load weight when Asset/Truck Load Weight cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation, or if read load weight must be calibrated.

Ignition.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of Asset's ignition key.

Ignition_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field Ignition_Raw when Asset/Truck's ignition key status cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

OperatorPresence.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset has an operator present.

OperatorEgress.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates that the operator has exited the Asset/Truck. Used by the Early Exit event reporting feature.

OperatorPresence_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field OperatorPresence_Raw when Asset/Truck's operator presence status cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

Moving.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is moving.

Moving_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field Moving_Raw when Asset/Truck moving status cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

Hydraulic.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's hydraulics are in use.

Hydraulic_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field Hydraulic_Raw when Asset/Truck Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxiliaryHydraulic.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's auxiliary hydraulic function is in use. This field encompasses all Aux Hydraulic functions.

AuxHydFunc1_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc1_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxHydFunc2_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc2_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxHydFunc3_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc3_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxHydFunc4_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc4_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxHydFunc5_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc5_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxHydFunc6_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field AuxHydFunc6_Raw when Asset/Truck Auxiliary Hydraulics cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

AuxPressure.description: Units: user defined. Input measures the auxilliary hydraulic pressure of the Asset/Truck.

AuxStabilizer.description: Units: user defined. Input measures the status of the auxilliary hydraulic stabilizer of the Asset/Truck.

Tilting.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is tilting its tynes/tray/load.

Tilting_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use field Tilting_Raw when Asset/Truck Tilting function cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

SideShifting.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is side shifting (or laterally positioning) its tynes/tray/load.

Laden.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is laden (carrying a load).

SeatBelt.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether operator has seatbelt fastened.

SeatBelt_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field SeatBelt_Raw when Asset/Truck seatbelt fasten status cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

ParkBrake.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset has its park brake engaged.

ParkBrake_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ParkBrake_Raw when Asset/Truck ParkBrake function cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

EngineRunning.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's engine is running.

ForwardGear.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's transmission is in forward gear.

ForwardGear_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ForwardGear_Raw when Asset/Truck's forward gear cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

ReverseGear.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's transmission is in reverse gear.

ReverseGear_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ReverseGear_Raw when Asset/Truck's reverse gear cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

Transmission_Raw.description: Units: N/A. Use raw transmission when transmission forward/reverse/neutral cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

TransmissionNeutral.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's transmission is in neutral.

TransmissionEngaged.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's transmission is engaged.

ContainerLocked_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ContainerLocked_Raw when Asset/Truck's container locked signal cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

Working.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is working.

Lifting.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is lifting its tynes/tray/load.

Lowering.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is lowering its tynes/tray/load.

Unattended.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is unattended (operator not present).

NoOperation.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset is in a state of no operation (not in active use).

EngineIdling.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's engine is idling.

CoolantLevelLow.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's coolant reservoir level is low.

OilPressureLow.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's oil pressure is low.

ContainerType.description: Units: Boolean. Type of Container asset is currently laden with.

ContainerSize20Foot.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the container spreader position for the Asset/Truck is sized for 20 foot containers. Applicable for Reach Stacker Container Handler Trucks.

ContainerSize20Foot_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ContainerSize20Foot_Raw when Asset/Truck's container spreader position cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

ContainerSize40Foot.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the container spreader position for the Asset/Truck is sized for 40 foot containers. Applicable for Reach Stacker Container Handler Trucks.

ContainerSize40Foot_Raw.description: Units: Boolean. Use field ContainerSize40Foot_Raw when Asset/Truck's container spreader position cannot be read directly or converted using a simple linear calculation.

ContainerSizeOther.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the container spreader position for the Asset/Truck is sized for other containers. Applicable for Reach Stacker Container Handler Trucks.

IHMode.description: Units: Boolean. Indicates IH Mode is active. IH is Intermodal Handler pick (Spreader with legs to pick trailer) - Used by Container Handler trucks.

ElectrolyteLevelLow.description: Units: Boolean. Current status of whether asset's battery has low electrolyte level.

EngineRpm.description: Units: RPM. Current Engine RPM (revolutions per minute) of asset.

LastDtc_ErrorCode.description: The Error Code of the last DTC (diagnostic trouble code) detected on the Asset / Truck CAN Bus. Error Code is reported by CAN Open and Zapi DTC formats.

LastDtc_NodeAddress.description: The Controller Node Address of the last DTC (diagnostic trouble code) detected on the Asset / Truck CAN Bus. Node Address is reported by CAN Open and Zapi DTC formats.

LastDtc_SourceAddress.description: The Controller Source Address of the last DTC (diagnostic trouble code) detected on the Asset / Truck CAN Bus. Source Address is reported by J1939 and DANA DTC formats.

LastDtc_Spn.description: The SPN (Suspect Parameter Number) of the last DTC (diagnostic trouble code) detected on the Asset / Truck CAN Bus. SPN is reported by J1939 DTC format.

LastDtc_Fmi.description: The FMI (Failure Mode Identifier) of the last DTC (diagnostic trouble code) detected on the Asset / Truck CAN Bus. FMI is reported by J1939 DTC format.

FuelCell_SerialNumber.description: The unique serial number of the Fuel Cell currently connected to the telemetry device. It is assumed the telemetry device is mounted to a truck that is powered by the fuel cell.

FuelCell_ModelNumber.description: The model number of the Fuel Cell currently connected to the telemetry device. It is assumed the telemetry device is mounted to a truck that is powered by the fuel cell.

FuelCell_StackSerialNumber.description: The serial number of the Fuel Cell Stack currently connected to the telemetry device. It is assumed the telemetry device is mounted to a truck that is powered by the fuel cell.

FuelCell_SoftwareVersion.description: Units: Software version as an array of bytes. The software version of the Fuel Cell currently connected to the telemetry device. Software Version is formatted as 4 bytes specified as Major, Minor, Revision, Build.

FuelCell_OperatingHours.description: Units: Seconds. The time the Fuel Cell spent operating over its lifetime.

FuelCell_HydrogenConsumed.description: Units: grams. The amount of Hydrogen Consumed by the Fuel Cell over its lifetime.

FuelCell_EnergyOutput.description: Units: Wh. The amount of energy output by the Fuel Cell over its lifetime. The energy output is calculated from stack current and voltage and ultracap voltage and estimate of balance of plant.

FuelCell_IdleMeter.description: Units: Seconds. The time the Fuel Cell spent powered on but not in use (i.e. idle) over its lifetime.

FuelCell_ReFuelCount.description: Units: Count. The total number of times the Fuel Cell has been re-fueled over its lifetime.

FuelCell_SessionCount.description: Units: Count. The total number of times the Fuel Cell has transitioned from Start Mode to Run Mode over its lifetime.

FuelCell_ReFuelStatus.description: Indicates current Fuel Cell Re-Fueling status.

oneOf.title: ReFueling

oneOf.title: Unavailable
oneOf.description: The Fuel Cell re-fueling status is currently unavailable.

oneOf.title: Error

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: The Fuel Cell re-fueling status is currently unknown.

FuelCell_SystemStatus.description: Indicates current Fuel Cell system status.

oneOf.title: Ready

oneOf.title: Shutdown

oneOf.title: Idle

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: The Fuel Cell system status is currently unknown.

BMS_ChargeAh.description: Units: Ah. Total ampere-hours recorded during charging of this Asset's/Truck's battery over its lifetime. Field read directly from CAN Bus rather than accumulated from raw battery data.

BMS_StateOfCharge.description: Units: Percent. Current state of charge of Asset's/Truck's battery. A value of -1 indicates an error reading.

BMS_DCVoltage.description: Units: 0.0625 V/Bit. DC Voltage at the Asset's/Truck's battery terminal. A value of 65535 indicates an error reading.

BMS_DCCurrent.description: Units: 0.0625 A/Bit. DC Current at the Asset's/Truck's battery terminal. A value of -32768 indicates an error reading.

BMS_BatteryTemp.description: Units: 1 DegC/Bit. Temperature of Asset's/Truck's battery system. A value of -128 indicates an error reading.

BMS_ThermalDerate.description: Units: 1 Percent/Bit. Asset/Truck performance derate as a percentage activated when the battery temperature approaches its thermal limit. A value of zero means full performance allowed, a Value above zero results in reduction of Asset/Truck performance i.e. top speed, acceleration and lift speed. A value of -1 indicates an error reading.

BMS_InhibitOperation.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset's/Truck's operation is inhibited.

BMS_ImmediateShutdown.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset/Truck is in immediate shutdown and cannot be operated.

BMS_LimitedOperation.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset's/Truck's operations are limited. The Asset/Truck activates this mode when the Battery State of Charge is low or a fault condition occurs that does not require immediate shutdown.

BMS_ChargerConnected.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates charger is currently connected to the Asset's/Truck's battery. The Asset/Truck will disable the traction system while the charger is connected.

BMS_LiftLockout.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset's/Truck's hoist function is disabled. The Asset/Truck activates this mode when the Battery State of Charge is low.

BMS_ThermalDerateEnable.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset/Truck thermal derate is active. The Asset/Truck activates this mode when the battery temperature approaches its thermal limit. In this mode the Asset/Truck reduces top speed, acceleration and lift speed reducing the overall average power consumption in an attempt to allow the battery to cool.

IdInterlockPassed.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates that the VAM is no longer waiting for or expecting ID Card Swipe or Pin Code Entry. ID Reader Interlock has been passed. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin, CAN or calculated input.

AllInterlocksPassed.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates that the VAM is no longer interlocking the Asset/Truck. ID Reader, Seat Belt, Checklist Interlocks are all passed. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin, CAN or calculated input.

CanBusActive.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates that the VAM is detecting activity on the Asset/Truck CAN Bus. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin, CAN or calculated input.

WireGuidanceLocked.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the Asset's/Truck's wire guidance status is locked.

OperatorLogOff.description: Units: Boolean. Input status for the 'Operator Log Off' feature. Internally calculated to be set true when both 'Ignition' and 'Operator Presence' inputs are inactive. Additional logic can be applied to this input through the input mapping table. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin or a CAN input.

BTDeviceConnected.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates a Bluetooth Device is currently connected to the Telemetry Device. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin or a CAN input.

BTKeyRemoved.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates a Bluetooth Device was used to unlock the Asset/Truck but is now removed/disconnected. This field can be used to trigger truck timeout. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin or a CAN input.

BTKeyUnlocked.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates a Bluetooth Device was used to unlock the Asset/Truck. This field is set internally and therefore must NOT be set to a pin or a CAN input.

BatteryCharging.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates Asset's/Truck's battery is being charged. This field is used by the Charge Utilisation event feature for Sumitomo trucks.

SuddenAccel.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the Asset/Truck has detected a Sudden Acceleration violation. This field is used by the Safety Violation event for Sumitomo trucks.

SuddenBrake.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the Asset/Truck has detected a Sudden Braking violation. This field is used by the Safety Violation event for Sumitomo trucks.

QuickTurn.description: Units: Boolean. When true indicates the Asset/Truck has detected a Quick Turn violation. This field is used by the Safety Violation event for Sumitomo trucks.

InterlockBypass.description: Units: Boolean. When true, and Interlock Bypass setting is enabled, if system is waiting for swipe, interlocks will be bypassed, and session will start recording and reporting.

Container20FtCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 20 foot sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container30FtCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 30 foot sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container40FtCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 40 foot sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

ContainerSingleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of single sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

ContainerDoubleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of double sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container20FtSingleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 20 foot single sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container40FtSingleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 40 foot single sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container20FtDoubleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 20 foot double sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

Container40FtDoubleCount.description: Units: Count. Sum of number of 40 foot double sized containers lifted by the asset over its lifetime.

FuelTankLevel.description: Units: percentage 0.4% per bit. Current fuel tank level as a percentage.

DEFTankLevel.description: Units: percentage 0.4% per bit. Current DEF tank level as a percentage.

EngineOilLevel.description: Units: percentage. Current Engine oil level as a percentage.

oneOf.title: Bad
oneOf.description: Engine oil level is bad or low.

oneOf.title: Good
oneOf.description: Engine oil level is good or not low.

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: It is unknown what the current Engine oil level is.

oneOf.title: HiP
oneOf.description: Engine mode is currently high performance.

oneOf.title: ECO
oneOf.description: Engine mode is currently economic mode.

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: It is unknown what the current Engine mode is.

ContainerOverride.description: Units: Count. Number of container handling override attempts by the asset over its lifetime.

device_id.description: The Unique identifier for the telemetry device that recorded this event.

device_type.description: The type of the telemetry device as an enum value e.g. FM1, VAM, SA1.

deviceHwVer.description: Units: CRC32. Hardware Version of the Telemetry Device. Hardware Version is formatted as two single byte integers specified as version and revision

modemMac.description: Units: MAC Address. The unique identifier of the primary Wi-Fi Modem within the telemetry device as an array of bytes.

modemImei.description: Units: IMEI. The International Mobile Equipment Identity number, The unique identifier of the Cellular Modem within the telemetry device as a string of digits.

modemModel.description: Units: Model Number. The Model Number of the cellular modem within the telemetry device.

modemSim.description: Units: SIM ICCID. The unique identifier of the primary SIM card used by the Cellular Modem within the telemetry device as a string of digits.

modemSimAlt.description: Units: SIM ICCID. The unique identifier of the secondary SIM card used by the Cellular Modem within the telemetry device as a string of digits.

modemVersion.description: The firmware version of the modem within the telemetry device as a string.

deviceFwVer.description: Units: Firmware Version as an array of integers. The firmware version of the primary processor within the telemetry device. Firmware Version is formatted as 5 two byte integers specified as Application, Major, Minor, Revision, Build Number.

deviceFwCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the firmware image currently running in the primary (main) processor within the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

deviceFwSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the firmware image currently running in the primary (main) processor within the telemetry device.

deviceFwVer_Io.description: Units: Firmware Version as an array of integers. The firmware version of the secondary (IO) processor within the telemetry device. Firmware Version is formatted as 5 two byte integers specified as Application, Major, Minor, Revision, Build Number.

deviceFwVer_IoBoot.description: Units: Firmware Version as an array of integers. The firmware version of the bootloader of the secondary processor within the telemetry device. Firmware Version is formatted as 5 two byte integers specified as Application, Major, Minor, Revision, Build Number.

deviceFwCrc_Io.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the firmware image currently running in the secondary processor within the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

deviceFwSize_Io.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the firmware image currently running in the secondary (IO) processor within the telemetry device.

displayFwVer.description: Units: Firmware Version as an array of integers. The firmware version of the User Interface Telemetry Display, directly linked to the telemetry device. Firmware Version is formatted as 4 single byte integers specified as Application, Major, Minor, Revision Number.

productId.description: Units: CRC32. Server assigned device identifier that can be used on the Telemetry Portal to search for a particular telemetry device.

settingsCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the settings configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

settingsSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the settings configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

settingsCrc_Loaded.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the settings configuration that is loaded in telemetry device RAM. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

settingsSize_Loaded.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the settings configuration that is loaded in telemetry device RAM.

checklistCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the checklist configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

checklistSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the checklist configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

operatorsCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the operator configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

operatorsSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the operator configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

inputDefCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the input definition configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

inputDefSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the input definition configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

eventConfigCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the event configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

eventConfigSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the event configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

phdDisplayTextCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the PHD display text configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

phdDisplayTextSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the PHD display text configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

fm2DisplayTextCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the FM2 display text / language configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

fm2DisplayTextSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the FM2 display text / language configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

oasConfigCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the OAS configuration currently stored in the telemetry device. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

oasConfigSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the OAS configuration currently stored in the telemetry device.

CanInput_RefId.description: Numeric reference ID of the input to store the CAN data against

CanInput_ByteOffset.description: Byte offset of input to apply CAN data against.

CanInput_StartBit.description: Start bit of desired data within 8 byte CAN Frame. Range 0 - 63.

CanInput_BitLength.description: Bit length of desired data within 8 byte CAN Frame. Range 0 - 32.

CanInput_DataType.description: Data Type of the field to be read from the CAN Bus.

oneOf.title: Bool
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'bool'. One bit value, either 1 or 0.

oneOf.title: U8
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'uint8_t'. Unsigned 8 bit integer, range 0 to 255.

oneOf.title: S8
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'int8_t'. Signed 8 bit integer, range -128 to 127.

oneOf.title: U16
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'uint16_t'. unsigned 16 bit integer, range 0 to 65535.

oneOf.title: S16
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'int16_t'. Signed 16 bit integer, range -32768 to 32767.

oneOf.title: U32
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'uint32_t'. Unsigned 32 bit integer, range 0 to 4294967295.

oneOf.title: S32
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'int32_t'. Signed 32 bit integer, range -2147483648 to 2147483647.

oneOf.title: String
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'uint8_t'. UTF-8 character array with a defined length, maximum length is 255.

oneOf.title: ByteArray
oneOf.description: DeviceType: 'uint8_t'. Unsigned 8 bit integer array with a defined length, maximum length is 255.

CanInput_Offset.description: The Offset, Multiplier and Divider allow for a basic linear conversion of the field data units once read from the CAN Bus. Allows for the field to be converted into the units expected by the Telemetry Device. Order as follows newValue = (((readValue + offset) * multiplier) / divider)

CanInput_Multiplier.description: The Offset, Multiplier and Divider allow for a basic linear conversion of the field data units once read from the CAN Bus. Allows for the field to be converted into the units expected by the Telemetry Device. Order as follows newValue = (((readValue + offset) * multiplier) / divider)

CanInput_Divider.description: The Offset, Multiplier and Divider allow for a basic linear conversion of the field data units once read from the CAN Bus. Allows for the field to be converted into the units expected by the Telemetry Device. Order as follows newValue = (((readValue + offset) * multiplier) / divider)

items.description: PDO format: CAN Header ID. For example 0x207

Each item can contain a CAN Open SDO. Format: MSByte is Node Address, Middle two bytes are Index (MSByte first), LSByte is SubIndex. For example node address of 0x7, index of 0x1005 and subIndex of 2 becomes 0x07100502.

Each item can contains a concatenation of J1939 priority, PGN (Parameter Group Number) and source address. Where bits 27-29 are the priority (3 bits), bits 8-26 are the PGN (2 bytes 2 bits) and bits 0-7 are the source address (1 byte). For example priority of 6, PGN of 0xFDB9 and source address of 0x17 becomes 0x18FDB917.

ZapiDtcFuncCode.description: Specifies the function code of a broadcasted active DTC. The format of the DTC message is expected to be either 3, 4 or 7 bytes in length with the error code field in a fixed position dependent on the length.

CanMain_SourceAddress.title: Device Source Address (Main)
CanMain_SourceAddress.description: Specifies the source address of the Telemetry Device for the CAN Network connected via the Main CAN Port (device pins G10, G11).

CanAux_SourceAddress.title: Device Source Address (Aux)
CanAux_SourceAddress.description: Specifies the source address of the Telemetry Device for the CAN Network connected via the Auxiliary CAN Port (device pins B09, B10).

CanCustom_CanId.description: CAN-ID of the custom CAN frame to be transmitted on the Truck (Main) CAN Bus.

CanCustom_DataLen.description: Data Length or DLC of CAN frame to be transmitted on the Truck (Main) CAN Bus.

CanCustom_LowerData.description: The first 4 bytes of data (bytes 1-4) of CAN frame to be transmitted on the Truck (Main) CAN Bus. Byte ordering is LittleEndian or Least Significant Byte first.

CanCustom_UpperData.description: The second 4 bytes of data (bytes 5-8) of CAN frame to be transmitted on the Truck (Main) CAN Bus. Byte ordering is LittleEndian or Least Significant Byte first.

PinInput_RefId.description: Numeric reference ID of the input to map against this particular Module Pin.

PinInput_DigitalThreshold.description: This threshold specifies the trigger or change over level of the input when it is being used as a digital input. When the input signal is above this level it is in a different state to when its below this level.

PinInput_Options_ActiveHigh.description: When true, indicates that the input is active when its associated module pin's value is above the digital threshold setting.

PinInput_Options_VariableVoltageSensor.description: When true, indicates the input is used for a varying voltage linear sensor. This relies on 2 points being specified to calculate the linear equation. If not enabled, the device will treat the input as a digital sensor - either high or low.

PinInput_Options_InternalPullup.description: When true, activates an internal pullup in this particular pin's measurement circuit. Only required when measuring an input that is either 'short to ground' or 'open circuit'.

PinInput_Options_FrequencySensor.description: When true, indicates the input is used to measure the frequency of a pulsed signal, for example a Speed or RPM signal.

PinInput_Options_CurrentSensor.description: When true, indicates the input is used to measure the current of a 4-20mA signal, for example Load Weight signal.

PinInput_VVS_Point1_Adc.description: Specifies the raw pin ADC value for known sample point #1 of the associated sensor, required when configuring the input as a variable voltage sensor.

PinInput_VVS_Point2_Adc.description: Specifies the raw pin ADC value for known sample point #2 of the associated sensor, required when configuring the input as a variable voltage sensor.

PinInput_VVS_Point1_Value.description: Specifies the sensor value for known sample point #1 of the associated sensor, required when configuring the input as a variable voltage sensor.

PinInput_VVS_Point2_Value.description: Specifies the sensor value for known sample point #2 of the associated sensor, required when configuring the input as a variable voltage sensor.

PinInput_Scale.description: Specifies the pin scale function for the pin input when configured in any mode.

oneOf.title: 10V
oneOf.description: The sensor input to the device pin is scaled to allow a read range of 0-10V.

oneOf.title: 5V
oneOf.description: The sensor input to the device pin is scaled to allow a read range of 0-5V.

oneOf.title: 3V3
oneOf.description: The sensor input to the device pin is scaled to allow a read range of 0-3V3.

oneOf.title: Custom
oneOf.description: The sensor input to the device pin has custom scaling specified by the Custom Scale value.

PinInput_ScaleCustom.description: Applicable when pin scale function is set to custom. Sets the resistance value of the scale function as a number between 0 and 127 where lower numbers result in a higher scale factor.

PinInput_Lpf.description: Specifies the low pass filter cut-off frequency for the pin input when configured in frequency sensor mode.

PinInput_LpfCustom.description: Applicable when pin frequency LPF function is set to custom. Sets the resistance value of the LPF filter as a number between 0 and 127 where lower numbers result in a lower LPF cutoff.

Speed_Max.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies the maximum value that speed input can be set to, a speed input over this value will result in a speed of zero.

Speed_pp10m.title: Pulses per 10m
Speed_pp10m.description: Units: pulses. Used to convert frequency (in Hz) read from an input pin to speed (in km/hr). Specifies the number of pulses detected over a 10 metre period.

Rpm_mult.title: RPM Multiplier
Rpm_mult.description: Used to convert frequency (in Hz) read from an input pin to RPM (in revolutions / minute). For example if input is measuring sparking of each cylinder, and the engine required all cylinders to fire for one rotation, then the frequency of the signal would need to be divided by the number of cylinders to become RPM (the conversion from seconds to minutes is automatically done).

Rpm_div.title: RPM Divider
Rpm_div.description: Used to convert frequency (in Hz) read from an input pin to RPM (in revolutions / minute). For example if input is measuring sparking of each cylinder, and the engine required all cylinders to fire for one rotation, then the frequency of the signal would need to be divided by the number of cylinders to become RPM (the conversion from seconds to minutes is automatically done).

LowSpeedOperationThreshold.title: Low Speed Operation Threshold
LowSpeedOperationThreshold.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Speed Operation Threshold for which Low and Medium Speed Operation Durations are calculated for the drive session event.

HighSpeedOperationThreshold.title: High Speed Operation Threshold
HighSpeedOperationThreshold.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Speed Operation Threshold for which High and Medium Speed Operation Durations are calculated for the drive session event.

LowOverSpeedThreshold.title: Low OverSpeed Threshold
LowOverSpeedThreshold.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Overspeed Threshold for which Low Overspeed Duration and Counts are calculated for the drive session event.

HighOverSpeedThreshold.title: High OverSpeed Threshold
HighOverSpeedThreshold.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Overspeed Threshold for which High Overspeed Duration and Counts are calculated for the drive session event.

OverSpeedReportDelay.title: OverSpeed Report Delay
OverSpeedReportDelay.description: Units: seconds. Specifies the time delay OverSpeed is detected before the system reports the occurrence to the portal via the drive session event.

BuzzOnOverSpeedEnable.title: Buzz on OverSpeed Enable
BuzzOnOverSpeedEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that while speed is over the 'High Level Overspeed Threshold' an audible alert is raised prompting operator to slow down. Alert sounds after delay specified by 'OverSpeed Buzz Delay' setting.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Speed statistics and overspeed violations will NOT be reported.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Statistics on both speed operation (high/low speed levels) and speed violation (high/low overspeed) are reported in the drive session summary event.

OverSpeedOptions_Buzz.title: Buzz On OverSpeed
OverSpeedOptions_Buzz.description: When true specifies that while speed is over the 'High Level Overspeed Threshold' an audible alert is raised prompting operator to slow down. Alert sounds after delay specified by 'OverSpeed Buzz Delay' setting.

OverSpeedOptions_Visual.title: Visual Alert On Violation
OverSpeedOptions_Visual.description: When true specifies that while speed is over the 'High Level Overspeed Threshold' a visual alert is raised on the Telemetry Display prompting operator to slow down. Visual alert is raised immediately without delay.

OverSpeedBuzzDelay.title: OverSpeed Buzz Delay
OverSpeedBuzzDelay.description: Units: seconds. Specifies the time delay after OverSpeed is detected before the operator is alerted via a buzz sequence.

SeatBeltViolationEnable.title: Seat Belt Reporting Enable
SeatBeltViolationEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that Seat Belt Violations are detected and reported by the system.

SeatBeltInterlockEnable.title: Seat Belt Interlock Enable
SeatBeltInterlockEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true the Operator will be prompted to fasten their Seat Belt prior to operating the Asset/Truck. Whether seat belt violations restrict drive and how violations are alerted to the operator is determined by other seat belt interlock settings.

ParkBrakeViolationEnable.title: Park Brake Violation Enable
ParkBrakeViolationEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that Park Brake Violations are detected and reported by the system.

SeatBeltViolationDelay.title: Seat Belt Report Delay
SeatBeltViolationDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the grace period between committing the violation and it being counted towards the seat belt violation count for the drive session event.

ParkBrakeViolationDelay.title: Park Brake Violation Delay
ParkBrakeViolationDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the grace period between committing the violation and it being counted towards the park brake violation count for the drive session event.

SeatBeltOptions_Buzz.title: Buzz On Violation
SeatBeltOptions_Buzz.description: When true, A seat belt violation raises an audible alert prompting operator to fasten seat belt. Alert sounds after delay specified by Seat Belt Buzz Delay. Alert Conditions: Operator ON seat, Ignition ON, SeatBelt not fastened OR Seat/SeatBelt sequence error detected.

SeatBeltOptions_Visual.title: Visual Alert On Violation
SeatBeltOptions_Visual.description: When true, A seat belt violation raises a visual alert on the Telemetry Display prompting operator to fasten seat belt. Visual Alert is enacted immediately (no delay setting). Alert Conditions: Operator ON seat, Ignition ON, SeatBelt not fastened OR Seat/SeatBelt sequence error detected.

SeatBeltOptions_Disable.title: Truck Disable On Violation
SeatBeltOptions_Disable.description: When true, A seat belt violation triggers Asset/Truck disable by overriding the current state of the telemetry relays. The overriden relay state is specified by the Seat Belt Truck Disable Relay setting. Relay Override Conditions: Ignition ON, Operator off seat OR SeatBelt not fastened OR Seat/SeatBelt sequence error detected.

SeatBeltOptions_Moving.title: Violations Only While Moving
SeatBeltOptions_Moving.description: When true, seat belt violations only apply while Asset/Truck is moving. Therefore Alerts and Relay Overrides will only occur while the vehicle is moving.

SeatBeltBuzzDelay.title: Seat Belt Buzz Delay
SeatBeltBuzzDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after a seat belt violation is detected before the operator is alerted via a buzz sequence.

SeatBeltDisableDelay.title: Seat Belt Truck Disable Delay
SeatBeltDisableDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after a seat belt violation is detected before Asset/Truck operation is disabled via relay override. Only applicable when Truck Disable feature is enabled.

SeatBeltOffSeatDelay.title: Seat Belt Off Seat Delay
SeatBeltOffSeatDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time where the seat belt is fastened while the operator is not present before a seat belt violation occurs.

SeatBeltDisableTime.title: Seat Belt Disable Time
SeatBeltDisableTime.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the mandatory truck disable time period when transitioning from seat belt violation to seat belt correctly fastened.

SeatBeltSpeedThres.title: Seat Belt Speed Threshold
SeatBeltSpeedThres.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies the Asset/Truck speed violation threshold over which the 'Violations Only While Moving' seat belt feature applies.

SeatBeltSpeedDiff.title: Seat Belt Speed Difference
SeatBeltSpeedDiff.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies the seat belt speed violation low threshold as a difference. For example a speed violation threshold of 8kph with a difference of 2kph, would result in seat belt violations being applied above 8kph, and no longer applied once speed drops below 6kph.

ParkBrakeOptions_Buzz.title: Buzz On Violation
ParkBrakeOptions_Buzz.description: When true, A park brake violation raises an audible alert prompting operator to apply park brake. Alert sounds after delay specified by Park Brake Buzz Delay. Alert Conditions: Operator OFF seat, Ignition ON, ParkBrake NOT engaged and buzz timeout enabled and elapsed.

ParkBrakeOptions_Visual.title: Visual Alert On Violation
ParkBrakeOptions_Visual.description: When true, A park brake violation raises a visual alert on the Telemetry Display prompting operator to apply parkbrake. Visual Alert is enacted immediately (no delay setting). Alert Conditions: Operator OFF seat, Ignition ON, ParkBrake NOT engaged.

ParkBrakeOptions_Disable.title: Truck Disable On Violation
ParkBrakeOptions_Disable.description: When true, A park brake violation triggers Asset/Truck disable by overriding the current state of the telemetry relays. The overriden relay state is specified by the Park Brake Truck Disable Relay setting. Relay Override Conditions: Operator OFF seat, Ignition ON, ParkBrake NOT engaged and truck disable timeout enabled and elapsed.

ParkBrakeOptions_Shutdown.title: Shutdown On Violation
ParkBrakeOptions_Shutdown.description: When true, during a park brake violation, the Asset/Truck is shutdown after the timeout elapses. Shutdown Conditions: Operator OFF seat, Ignition ON, ParkBrake NOT engaged and shutdown timeout enabled and elapsed.

ParkBrakeBuzzDelay.title: Park Brake Buzz Delay
ParkBrakeBuzzDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after a park brake violation is detected before the operator is alerted via a buzz sequence.

ParkBrakeDisableDelay.title: Park Brake Truck Disable Delay
ParkBrakeDisableDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after a park brake violation is detected before Asset/Truck operation is disabled via relay override. Only applicable when Truck Disable feature is enabled.

ParkBrakeDisableTime.title: Park Brake Disable Time
ParkBrakeDisableTime.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the mandatory truck disable time period when speed drops below the speed violation threshold.

ParkBrakeShutdownDelay.title: Park Brake Shutdown Delay
ParkBrakeShutdownDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after a park brake violation is detected before Asset/Truck is shutdown. Only applicable when Shutdown On Violation feature is enabled.

ParkBrakeSpeedThres.title: Park Brake Speed Violation
ParkBrakeSpeedThres.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies the Asset/Truck speed threshold for park brake violation. If operator engages park brake when speed is higher than threshold, this instance will be counted and reported.

LoadSensingOptions_Enable.title: Enable
LoadSensingOptions_Enable.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Load Sensing. When Enabled, the system will internally calculate the Laden input, based on either 'LoadWeight using the specified Laden and Unladen thresholds, or via the ContainerLocked input.  The 'Log Loads Lifted' setting must be enabled for reporting of individual details of each load lifted to the portal.

LoadSensingOptions_LogLoadsLifted.title: Log Loads Lifted
LoadSensingOptions_LogLoadsLifted.description: Units: Boolean. Enables event reporting of individual loads lifted. When enabled the device will record and report details of each load lifted to the portal, including load sequence number, weight of load lifted (if available) and duration of time spent laden.

LoadSensingOptions_Calibrate.title: Calibrate
LoadSensingOptions_Calibrate.description: Units: Boolean. When ticked, the telemetry device internally calibrates Load Weight Raw, using load calibration settings, and sets the result to the Load Weight Input.

LadenSustainTime.title: Laden Sustain Time
LadenSustainTime.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the grace period while the current load is above the laden threshold before the system considers the truck laden.

UnladenSustainTime.title: Unladen Sustain Time
UnladenSustainTime.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the grace period while the current load is below the unladen threshold before the system considers the truck no longer laden.

LadenThresPercent.title: Laden Threshold Percent (BigTruck)
LadenThresPercent.description: Units: Percent %. Specifies the load threshold as a percentage of truck maximum load, where if the current load exceeds this threshold the system considers the asset / truck laden, and if the current load dips below this threshold the system considers the asset / truck no longer laden. Note this field only applies to BigTruck Models.

LadenThreshold.title: Laden Threshold
LadenThreshold.description: Units: Kg. Specifies the load threshold, where if the current load exceeds this threshold for longer than the specified 'laden sustain time' the system considers the asset / truck laden.

UnladenThreshold.title: Unladen Threshold
UnladenThreshold.description: Units: Kg. Specifies the load threshold, where if the current load dips below this threshold for longer than the specified 'unladen sustain time' the system considers the asset / truck no longer laden.

OverloadOptions_Enable.title: Enable Overload Detection
OverloadOptions_Enable.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Overload Detection. When Enabled, the system will detect overload condition based on referenced Overload Weight Threshold.

OverloadOptions_Buzz.title: Buzz on Overload
OverloadOptions_Buzz.description: Units: Boolean. Enables overload audiable alert. When enabled alerts operator via buzz sequence that an overload condition has been detected. Overload Buzz sequence is five consecutive short buzzes.

OverloadOptions_Visual.title: Visual Alert on Overload
OverloadOptions_Visual.description: Units: Boolean. Enables overload visual alert. When enabled alerts operator via visual display message that an overload condition has been detected. Overload visual alert remains on screen while overload condition is active.

OverloadOptions_Report.title: Report Overload
OverloadOptions_Report.description: Units: Boolean. Enables overload event reporting. When enabled reports each individual overload occurrence to the telemetry system, including peak load and time overloaded.

OverloadOptions_Disable.title: Asset Disable On Overload
OverloadOptions_Disable.description: Units: Boolean. When enabled an overload condition triggers Asset/Truck disable by overriding the current state of the telemetry relays. The overriden relay state is specified by the Overload Asset Disable Relay setting.

OverloadBuzzDelay.title: Overload Buzz Delay
OverloadBuzzDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay between the telemetry device detecting an overload condition and alerting the operator via buzz sequence.

OverloadReportDelay.title: Overload Report Delay
OverloadReportDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay between the telemetry device detecting an overload condition and the occurrence being reported to the telemetry server.

OverloadDisableDelay.title: Overload Asset Disable Delay
OverloadDisableDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time after an overload condition is detected before Asset/Truck operation is disabled via relay override. Only applicable when Truck Disable feature is enabled.

OverloadPreRestoreDelay.title: Overload Minimum Disable Period
OverloadPreRestoreDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the mandatory truck disable time period once overloaded before truck is operational.

OverloadRestoreTime.title: Overload Restore Period
OverloadRestoreTime.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period during overload for which Asset/Truck operation is temporarily restored. Operator temporarily restores operation via button press on the Display. Only applies for overload asset disable feature.

OverloadThreshold.title: Overload Threshold
OverloadThreshold.description: Units: Kg. Specifies the overload threshold, where if the current load exceeds this threshold the telemetry device will consider the Asset/Truck overloaded and proceed with alerts and event reporting.

LoadCal_NoLoadRaw.title: No Load (Raw)
LoadCal_NoLoadRaw.description: Units: ADC value. Forms part of the calibration of the Weigh Gauge. Specifies the raw value of the Load sensor when the Forklift Tynes are raised off the ground at the measurement position without any load.

LoadCal_KnownLoadRaw.title: Known Load (Raw)
LoadCal_KnownLoadRaw.description: Units: ADC value. Forms part of the calibration of the Weigh Gauge. Specifies the raw value of the Load sensor when the Forklift Tynes are raised to the measurement position with a known load. The known load weight is specified by the known load (weight) setting.

LoadCal_KnownLoad.title: Known Load (Weight)
LoadCal_KnownLoad.description: Units: Kg. Forms part of the calibration of the Weigh Gauge. Specifies the weight of the known load corresponding to the raw value measured when raising the known load to the measurement position.

PinCodeEnable.title: Pin Code Enable
PinCodeEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that the telemetry device will restrict Asset/Truck access based on Pin Code entry.

oneOf.title: ID Reader Only
oneOf.description: ID Interlock must be passed by swiping a card against the ID Reader.

oneOf.title: Key Pad Only
oneOf.description: ID Interlock must be passed by entering a pin code through the Telemetry Display. This feature is only available when fitted with a PHD display.

oneOf.title: Both ID Reader and Key Pad
oneOf.description: ID Interlock can be passed by either swiping a card against the ID reader or entering a pin code through the Telemetry Display. This feature is only available when fitted with a PHD display.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Operator Identification is NOT required to access Truck/Asset.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Restricts access to the Truck/Asset until operator swipes valid card or enters valid pin code.

oneOf.title: Once Pass Off
oneOf.description: Grants access to the Truck/Asset after swipe or pin code entered. Operator Identification is NOT checked against valid list. Once access is granted, ID Interlock is automatically disabled. This feature is used to validate the interlock and ID Reader / Pin Code operation at the point of install, letting the vehicle operate without restriction once install is verified. This feature should not be used for any other purpose.

oneOf.title: Any Swipe
oneOf.description: Grants access to the Truck/Asset after swipe or pin code entered. Operator Identification is NOT checked against valid list, any Card swiped is granted access. This feature is used to validate the interlock and ID Reader / Pin Code operation at the point of install or to allow a service technician to perform testing without a customer site card. This feature should not be used for any other purpose. Only supported in VAM firmware versions IO v6.10.X and Main v9.13.X and above, and VAM NCEA firmware versions IO v3.3.13.1 and Main v3.11.38.1 and above.
Sets the communication speed of the RS232 line between device and ID Reader to 115200 BAUD.
Sets the communication speed of the RS232 line between device and ID Reader to 2400 BAUD.
Sets the communication speed of the RS232 line between device and ID Reader to 9600 BAUD.
Sets the communication speed of the RS232 line between device and ID Reader to 57600 BAUD.

oneOf.title: Default Method
oneOf.description: Uses the standard method for extracting the Operator ID from the ID Reader message protocol.

oneOf.title: Decimal 4 digits
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 2 Byte Decimal sequence MSB first.

oneOf.title: Hex 4 digits
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 2 Byte Hexadecimal sequence MSB first.

oneOf.title: Hex 8 digits Reversed
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 4 Byte Hexadecimal sequence LSB first (i.e. in reverse order).

oneOf.title: Hex 8 digits Forward
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 4 Byte Hexadecimal sequence MSB first.

oneOf.title: Hex 5 digits
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 2.5 Byte (5 digit) Hexadecimal sequence LSB first.

oneOf.title: Hex 6 digits
oneOf.description: Extracts the Operator ID from the ID Reader message as a 3 Byte (6 digit) Hexadecimal sequence LSB first.

IdReaderFcOffset.title: ID Reader Facility Code Byte Offset
IdReaderFcOffset.description: Units: byte offset. Specifies the starting byte offset used to extract the Facility Code from the ID Reader Communication Protocol.

IdDisplayOptions_IdDenied.title: Display on Access Denied
IdDisplayOptions_IdDenied.description: When true, display shows the IDs of the last swiped card after being denied access to the system.

IdDisplayOptions_IdGranted.title: Display on Access Granted
IdDisplayOptions_IdGranted.description: When true, display shows the IDs of the last swiped card after being granted access to the system.

IdDisplayOptions_CardId.title: Display Card ID
IdDisplayOptions_CardId.description: When true, displays the Card ID of the last swiped card depending on the Denied/Granted display options.

IdDisplayOptions_FC.title: Display Facility Code
IdDisplayOptions_FC.description: When true, displays the Facility Code of the last swiped card depending on the Denied/Granted display options.

IdDisplayOptions_Hex.title: Display ID in Hex
IdDisplayOptions_Hex.description: When true, the Card ID or Facility Code displayed after swipe is formatted as a hexadecimal number.

oneOf.title: Disable
oneOf.description: Telemetry Display is disabled. If a display is fitted to the Asset/Truck, the display will remain blank.

oneOf.title: Enable
oneOf.description: Enables Telemetry Display.

oneOf.title: AutoDetect
oneOf.description: Device detects whether or not a telemetry display is fitted to the Asset/Truck.

oneOf.title: FM2
oneOf.description: Telemetry Display fitted to the system is an FM2 Display.

oneOf.title: FMT35 or PHD
oneOf.description: Telemetry Display fitted to the system is a Parker PHD28 or FM-touch 35.

oneOf.title: AutoDetect
oneOf.description: Device detects which type of display is fitted to the system.

oneOf.title: MPH
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Speed will be displayed in Miles per hour.

oneOf.title: KPH
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Speed will be displayed in Kilometers per hour.

oneOf.title: KPH rounded
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Speed will be displayed in Kilometers per hour with no decimal places.

oneOf.title: Miles
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Distance will be displayed in Miles.

oneOf.title: Kilometers
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Distance will be displayed in Kilometers.

oneOf.title: Pounds
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Weight will be displayed in Pounds.

oneOf.title: Kilograms
oneOf.description: When not customised on the display itself Weight will be displayed in Kilograms.

DisplayBrand.title: Display Brand
DisplayBrand.description: Specifies the brand of the telemetry display.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: FM2 will be powered down once the system powers down.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: FM2 will remain powered even when the system is powered down, to allow it to run in a very cold environment i.e. freezer room.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: FM2 temperature control is disabled.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: FM2 temperature control is enabled.

FM2TempSetPoint.title: FM2 Temperature Set Point
FM2TempSetPoint.description: Units: 0.1 DegC/Bit. Sets the point below which the FM2 Display Module will attempt to heat itself.

FM2ThermoHysteresis.title: FM2 Thermostat Hysteresis
FM2ThermoHysteresis.description: Units: 0.1 DegC/Bit. Sets the point below which the FM2 Display Module will attempt to heat itself.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: The FM2 Display's LCD backlight will remain lit at all times while the display is active.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Enables the FM2 Display's backlight timeout feature, which allows the Display's LCD backlight to turn off after a period of button inactivity, only on the hour meter and system information screens. The length of inactivity period is set via the backlight timeout period setting.

FM2BacklightPeriod.title: FM2 Backlight Timeout Period
FM2BacklightPeriod.description: Units: Seconds. Sets the period of inactivity after which the FM2 Display's backlight will turn off. Only applies when the FM2 Display backlight control feature is enabled.

ChecklistEnable.title: Checklist Enable
ChecklistEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true enables the Pre-Start/Post-Start Checklist feature. Otherwise when false checklist is disabled.

ChecklistOptions_Lockout.title: Apply Lockout
ChecklistOptions_Lockout.description: When true, Allows the checklist questions to lockout the Asset/Truck, preventing further pending review from Technician / Supervisor. The Checklist Configuration specifies which individual questions trigger lockout.

ChecklistOptions_TimeLimit.title: Apply Question Time Limit
ChecklistOptions_TimeLimit.description: When true, a response time limit is applied to each question. If the time limit is exceeded, the occurrence is reported to the telemetry server in the checklist event.

ChecklistOptions_Disable.title: Apply No Response Asset Disable
ChecklistOptions_Disable.description: When true, a response time limit is applied to each Post-Start Checklist question. If the time limit is exceeded, Asset/Truck operation is disabled via the Asset Disable Relay Control settings.

Checklist_TimeLimit.title: Question Time Limit
Checklist_TimeLimit.description: When true, a response time limit is applied to each question. If the time limit is exceeded, the occurrence is reported to the telemetry server in the checklist event.

Checklist_NoResponse.title: No Response Shutdown
Checklist_NoResponse.description: When true, triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects no response to a checklist question for longer than the timeout period.

Checklist_PreStartShutdownDelay.title: Pre-Start Shutdown Delay
Checklist_PreStartShutdownDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period while waiting for a response to a Pre-Start Checklist question before asset / truck is shutdown. This time delay applies to each individual pre-start checklist question. Shutdown only occurs when 'No Response' shutdown checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_PostStartShutdownDelay.title: Post-Start Shutdown Delay
Checklist_PostStartShutdownDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period while waiting for a response to a Post-Start Checklist question before asset / truck is shutdown. This time delay applies to each individual post-start checklist question. Shutdown only occurs when 'No Response' shutdown checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_PreStartOverTimeDelay.title: Pre-Start OverTime Delay
Checklist_PreStartOverTimeDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period while waiting for a response to a Pre-Start Checklist question before an over-time occurrence is reported via the checklist event. This time limit applies to each individual Pre-Start checklist question. Reporting response over-time only occurs when 'Apply Question Time Limit' checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_PostStartOverTimeDelay.title: Post-Start OverTime Delay
Checklist_PostStartOverTimeDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period while waiting for a response to a Post-Start Checklist question before an over-time occurrence is reported via the checklist event. This time limit applies to each individual Post-Start checklist question. Reporting response over-time only occurs when 'Apply Question Time Limit' checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_AssetDisableDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period while waiting for a Post-Start checklist question response before Asset / Truck operation is disabled. This time delay applies to each individual Post-Start checklist question. Disable only occurs when 'Apply No Response Asset Disable' checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_MinimumAssetDisablePeriod.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the mandatory Asset / Truck disable time period after no response to a post-start checklist question before the operator is allowed to restore Asset / Truck operation. Disable only occurs when 'Apply No Response Asset Disable' checklist feature is enabled.

Checklist_Frequency.title: Checklist Frequency
Checklist_Frequency.description: Units: Checklist Frequency Option. Specifies the schedule of when the operator is prompted with the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Every Startup
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist on every Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 8 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 8 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 12 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 12 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 24 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 24 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Once Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every shift, where shifts are specified by the 4 shift time settings.

Checklist_OperatorOption.title: Checklist Operator Option
Checklist_OperatorOption.description: Units: Checklist Operator Option. Specifies the schedule of when the operator is prompted with the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Once Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that only one Checklist is to be completed on the Asset/Truck per shift.

oneOf.title: Every Operator Change
oneOf.description: Specifies that a Checklist is to be completed each time a new operator logs onto the Asset/Truck per shift.

oneOf.title: Once Per Operator Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that a Checklist is to be completed by each and every operator that logs onto the Asset/Truck per shift.

Checklist_Frequency_SA.title: Checklist Frequency
Checklist_Frequency_SA.description: Units: Checklist Frequency Option. Specifies the schedule of when the operator is prompted with the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Unspecified
oneOf.description: Checklist frequency is not specified.

oneOf.title: Every Startup
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist on every Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 8 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 8 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 12 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 12 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Every 24 Hours
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every 24 hours on Asset start.

oneOf.title: Once Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Operator is prompted with the Checklist every shift, where shifts are specified by the 4 shift time settings.

oneOf.title: Once Pass Off
oneOf.description: Prompts the checklist to be answered on the next power up, once answered the telemetry device will automatically disable the checklist for subsequent power ons. This feature is used to validate the interlock and checklist operation at the point of install, letting the Asset/Truck operate without restriction once install is verified. This feature should not be used for any other purpose.

Checklist_OperatorOption_SA.title: Checklist Operator Option
Checklist_OperatorOption_SA.description: Units: Checklist Operator Option. Specifies the schedule of when the operator is prompted with the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Unspecified
oneOf.description: Checklist Operator Option is not specified.

oneOf.title: Once Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that only one Checklist is to be completed on the Asset/Truck per shift.

oneOf.title: Every Operator Change
oneOf.description: Specifies that a Checklist is to be completed each time a new operator logs onto the Asset/Truck per shift.

oneOf.title: Once Per Operator Per Shift
oneOf.description: Specifies that a Checklist is to be completed by each and every operator that logs onto the Asset/Truck per shift.

Checklist_StartTimeShift1.title: Shift 1 Start Time
Checklist_StartTimeShift1.description: Units: 24Hour Military Time (e.g. 8:30am entered as 0830, 10:00am entered as 2200). Specifies the starting time of shift 1. Shifts are used to specify when the operator is prompted with the Checklist, applicable when Checklist frequency setting is set to 'Once Per Shift'. Shifts must be in chronological order, i.e shift 1 must be before shift 2, and shift 2 must be before shift 3. If not all four shifts times are required, leave the higher number shift times at zero. Examples: One shift at 9am shift1 = 900, shift2 = 0, shift 3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Two shifts per day (7am-7pm and 7pm-7am) shift1 = 700, shift2 = 1900, shift3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Three 8 hour shifts per day starting at 6am, shift1 = 600, shift2 = 1400, shift3 = 2200, shift4 = 0.

Checklist_StartTimeShift2.title: Shift 2 Start Time
Checklist_StartTimeShift2.description: Units: 24Hour Military Time (e.g. 8:30am entered as 0830, 10:00am entered as 2200). Specifies the starting time of shift 2. Shifts are used to specify when the operator is prompted with the Checklist, applicable when Checklist frequency setting is set to 'Once Per Shift'. Shifts must be in chronological order, i.e shift 1 must be before shift 2, and shift 2 must be before shift 3. If not all four shifts times are required, leave the higher number shift times at zero. Examples: One shift at 9am shift1 = 900, shift2 = 0, shift 3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Two shifts per day (7am-7pm and 7pm-7am) shift1 = 700, shift2 = 1900, shift3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Three 8 hour shifts per day starting at 6am, shift1 = 600, shift2 = 1400, shift3 = 2200, shift4 = 0.

Checklist_StartTimeShift3.title: Shift 3 Start Time
Checklist_StartTimeShift3.description: Units: 24Hour Military Time (e.g. 8:30am entered as 0830, 10:00am entered as 2200). Specifies the starting time of shift 3. Shifts are used to specify when the operator is prompted with the Checklist, applicable when Checklist frequency setting is set to 'Once Per Shift'. Shifts must be in chronological order, i.e shift 1 must be before shift 2, and shift 2 must be before shift 3. If not all four shifts times are required, leave the higher number shift times at zero. Examples: One shift at 9am shift1 = 900, shift2 = 0, shift 3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Two shifts per day (7am-7pm and 7pm-7am) shift1 = 700, shift2 = 1900, shift3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Three 8 hour shifts per day starting at 6am, shift1 = 600, shift2 = 1400, shift3 = 2200, shift4 = 0.

Checklist_StartTimeShift4.title: Shift 4 Start Time
Checklist_StartTimeShift4.description: Units: 24Hour Military Time (e.g. 8:30am entered as 0830, 10:00am entered as 2200). Specifies the starting time of shift 4. Shifts are used to specify when the operator is prompted with the Checklist, applicable when Checklist frequency setting is set to 'Once Per Shift'. Shifts must be in chronological order, i.e shift 1 must be before shift 2, and shift 2 must be before shift 3. If not all four shifts times are required, leave the higher number shift times at zero. Examples: One shift at 9am shift1 = 900, shift2 = 0, shift 3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Two shifts per day (7am-7pm and 7pm-7am) shift1 = 700, shift2 = 1900, shift3 = 0, shift4 = 0. Three 8 hour shifts per day starting at 6am, shift1 = 600, shift2 = 1400, shift3 = 2200, shift4 = 0.

Checklist_TechAccess.title: Checklist for Technician Access
Checklist_TechAccess.description: Units: Checklist for Technician Access Option. Specifies how Technician or higher level access affects the prompting of the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Never
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will never prompt the operator to complete a checklist, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Regular Schedule
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist as per the regular schedule based on the 'Checklist Frequency' setting, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Only After Lockout
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist only after a lockout has been cleared, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Regular Schedule And Lockout
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist as per the regular schedule based on the 'Checklist Frequency' setting AND after a lockout has been cleared, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

Checklist_TechAccess_SA.title: Checklist for Technician Access
Checklist_TechAccess_SA.description: Units: Checklist for Technician Access Option. Specifies how Technician or higher level access affects the prompting of the Checklist.

oneOf.title: Unspecified
oneOf.description: Checklist Tech Access is not specified.

oneOf.title: Never
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will never prompt the operator to complete a checklist, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Regular Schedule
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist as per the regular schedule based on the 'Checklist Frequency' setting, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Only After Lockout
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist only after a lockout has been cleared, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Regular Schedule And Lockout
oneOf.description: Specifies that the system will prompt the operator to complete the checklist as per the regular schedule based on the 'Checklist Frequency' setting AND after a lockout has been cleared, when logged in with Technician or higher level access.

UnlockLogout.title: Technician Unlock Log Out
UnlockLogout.description: Units: Unlock Log Out Option. Specifies whether or not Technician/Supervisor/RME access will automatically trigger Asset/Truck log off / shutdown after unlocking the Asset/Truck from a Checklist or Impact lockout.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: The Technician Unlock Log Out feature is disabled. Technician/Supervisor/RME access will NOT automatically trigger Asset/Truck log off / shutdown after unlocking the Asset/Truck from Checklist or Impact lockout.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: The Technician Unlock Log Out feature is enabled. Technician/Supervisor/RME access will automatically trigger Asset/Truck log off / shutdown after unlocking the Asset/Truck from Checklist or Impact lockout.

VSM_ImpactSensorEnable.title: VSM Impact Sensor Enable
VSM_ImpactSensorEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies to enable the impact sensor module for the Asset/Truck which is separate the telemetry device. For the Smart Antenna System both this setting and ImpactEnable must be true for the system to detect and report impacts, otherwise impacts are NOT detected or reported.

ImpactEnable.title: Impact Sensing Enable
ImpactEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that the telemetry device will detect and report impacts. Otherwise when false impacts are NOT detected or reported.

ImpactShutdownEnable.title: Shutdown Enable
ImpactShutdownEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that impacts detected above the shutdown threshold will trigger Asset/Truck shutdown. The asset will then be locked out preventing further use, pending review from a service technician or supervisor. Shutdown will only occur when Asset/Truck is stationary and shutdown delay has elapsed.

ImpactSoftSdEnable.title: Soft Shutdown Enable
ImpactSoftSdEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that impacts detected above the shutdown threshold will trigger a lockout for next Asset/Truck start. The asset will then be locked out preventing further use, pending review from a service technician or supervisor. Note that this feature does NOT trigger/force Asset/Truck shutdown, only prevents truck re-start once operator has turned off / logged off Asset/Truck. This feature may be used in conjunction with the Operator Performance Limit Reduced Speed feature.

ImpactImmediateShutdown.title: Immediate Shutdown Enable
ImpactImmediateShutdown.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that impacts detected above the shutdown threshold will trigger an immediate Asset/Truck shutdown (after shutdown delay elapses) regardless of whether the truck is in operation (i.e. moving or manoeuvring a load). The asset will then be locked out preventing further use, pending review from a service technician or supervisor. WARNING!  DO NOT ENABLE this feature without written consent from Global Platform Leader.  Enabling this setting will be reviewed on a customer and application basis.  Shutting equipment down in some applications while in motion could potentially cause harm to operator, equipment, and/or loads.
