ImpactOpsFilter.title: Impact Operator Presence Filter
ImpactOpsFilter.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that impacts will be ignored (not recorded) when the operator is not present on the Asset/Truck. This helps to filter out false (operational type) impacts.

ImpactRawData.title: Impact Raw Data Logging
ImpactRawData.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that impacts detected above the full logging threshold will be logged with raw accelerometer data, totaling ~5KB per impact. Otherwise when false impact raw accelerometer data is not logged/reported.

BuzzOnImpactDetect.title: Buzz on Impact Detect
BuzzOnImpactDetect.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies to sound an Audible Alert on the Telemetry Device detects an Impact.

VisualAlertOnImpactDetect.title: Visual Alert on Impact Detect
VisualAlertOnImpactDetect.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies to display a visual alert to the operator on the Telemetry Display once the Telemetry Device detects an Impact.

TimedOutputOnImpactDetect.title: Timed Output on Impact Detect
TimedOutputOnImpactDetect.description: Units: boolean. When true holds Buzzer Output (B06) high after impact detected, for duration specified by 'Timed Output Duration'. This feature may be used with an External Relay circuit to trigger an additional action on impact.

AlertOnBasicImpact.title: Alert on Basic Impact
AlertOnBasicImpact.description: Units: boolean. When true specifies that basic impacts will trigger an alert per detection of a full impact. This feature may be useful during onsite impact testing.

ImpactHThres.title: Impact Full Logging Horizontal Threshold
ImpactHThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold value for the impact sensor in the horizontal direction, when the telemetry device detects an impact with magnitude above this threshold in the horizontal plane the details of the impact is logged and reported to the Telemetry server.

ImpactVThres.title: Impact Full Logging Vertical Threshold
ImpactVThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold value for the impact sensor in the vertical direction, when the telemetry device detects an impact with magnitude above this threshold in the vertical plane the details of the impact is logged and reported to the Telemetry server.

ImpactBasicHThres.title: Impact Basic Activity Horizontal Threshold
ImpactBasicHThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold value for the noise floor reporting feature of the impact sensor in the horizontal direction. When the telemetry device detects acceleration activity with magnitude above this threshold in the horizontal plane the details of this noise floor activity event is logged and reported to the Telemetry server.

ImpactBasicVThres.title: Impact Basic Activity Vertical Threshold
ImpactBasicVThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold value for the noise floor reporting feature of the impact sensor in the vertical direction. When the telemetry device detects acceleration activity with magnitude above this threshold in the vertical plane the details of this noise floor activity event is logged and reported to the Telemetry server.

ImpactShdwnHThres.title: Impact Shutdown Horizontal Threshold
ImpactShdwnHThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the shutdown threshold value for the impact sensor in the Horizontal direction. When the telemetry device detects an impact with magnitude exceeding the logging threshold, if the magnitude is above the shutdown threshold in the horizontal plane, the telemetry device will shut the asset / truck down. Shutdown only occurs when this feature is enabled via the Enable Impact Shutdown Option.

ImpactShdwnVThres.title: Impact Shutdown Vertical Threshold
ImpactShdwnVThres.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the shutdown threshold value for the impact sensor in the Vertical direction. When the telemetry device detects an impact with magnitude exceeding the logging threshold, if the magnitude is above the shutdown threshold in the vertical plane, the telemetry device will shut the asset / truck down. Shutdown only occurs when this feature is enabled via the Enable Impact Shutdown Option.

ImpactShdwnDelay.title: Impact Shutdown Delay
ImpactShdwnDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay after impact before the system shuts the asset / truck down. Shutdown only occurs when this feature is enabled via the Enable Impact Shutdown Option.

ImpactLPF.title: Impact Low Pass Filter
ImpactLPF.description: Units: Low Pass Filter Frequency. Specifies the value of the Low Pass Filter to be applied to the impact detection algorithm.

ImpactForkDirectionAxis.title: Fork Direction Axis
ImpactForkDirectionAxis.description: Units: Axis Direction. Specifies the Impact Sensor's axis aligned to the direction of forks.

oneOf.title: +X
oneOf.description: Positive X in direction of forks

oneOf.title: -X
oneOf.description: Negative X in direction of forks

oneOf.title: +Y
oneOf.description: Positive Y in direction of forks

oneOf.title: -Y
oneOf.description: Negative Y in direction of forks

oneOf.title: +Z
oneOf.description: Positive Z in direction of forks

oneOf.title: -Z
oneOf.description: Negative Z in direction of forks

ImpactPitchRollEnable.title: Impact Pitch Roll Enable
ImpactPitchRollEnable.description: Units: Enable/Disable. Enable/Disable the broadcasting of the Pitch/Roll values for the impact sensor.

EventLimitImpact.title: Impact Event Daily Limit
EventLimitImpact.description: Units: Count. Specifies a limit for the number of impact events (above 'Full Logging Threshold') that can be logged within one day. Any impacts detected after this limit has been reached will be ignored, i.e not logged to the system. Note: If this field is zero the limit is set to the default value.Specifies a limit for the number of impact events (above "Full Logging Threshold") that can be logged within one day. Any impacts detected after this limit has been reached will be ignored, i.e not logged to the system. Note: If this field is zero the limit is set to the default value.

EventLimitBasic.title: Basic Activity Event Daily Limit
EventLimitBasic.description: Units: Event Count. Specifies a limit for the number of activity events (above 'Basic Activity Threshold' but below 'Full Logging Threshold') that can be logged within one day. Any activity events detected after this limit has been reached will be ignored, i.e not logged to the system. Note: If this field is zero the limit is set to the default value.

DeviceMountingOrientation.description: Units: Orientation Code. Specifies the mounting orientation of the telemetry device. This field is used by the internal accelerometer to offset the effects of gravity and to split impact magnitude into vertical and horizontal components.

oneOf.title: NotSet
oneOf.description: Orientation code has not been set for this telemetry device

ImpAlg_ActTrigDuration.title: Impact Algorithm Activity Trigger Duration
ImpAlg_ActTrigDuration.description: Units: sample number. Specifies the number of consecutive samples above or below the activity threshold to determine the start or end of the activity window.

ImpAlg_MinEventDuration.title: Impact Algorithm - Minimum Event Duration
ImpAlg_MinEventDuration.description: Units: sample number. Specifies the minimum length of the activity window, i.e the minimum number of samples above the activity threshold before logging the impact as an event.

ImpAlg_ActTrigThresh.title: Impact Algorithm - Activity Trigger Threshold
ImpAlg_ActTrigThresh.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold above and below which the activity window is defined.

ImpAlg_DirTrigThresh.title: Impact Algorithm - Direction Trigger Threshold
ImpAlg_DirTrigThresh.description: Units: 0.001 g/bit. Specifies the threshold above which starts the direction algorithm calculation.

ImpAlg_DirWindowDuration.title: Impact Algorithm - Direction Window Duration
ImpAlg_DirWindowDuration.description: Units: sample number. Specifies the sample time period between Activity Start and Direction End. This field is used to determine which samples are used in the determination of impact direction.

ImpactAlertOptions_BuzzEnable.title: Buzz on Impact
ImpactAlertOptions_BuzzEnable.description: When enabled, alerts the operator via buzz sequence that an impact (above 'Full Logging Threshold') has been detected, logged and reported. Buzz sequence for this alert is Long-Short-Short.

ImpactAlertOptions_VisualAlertEnable.title: Visual Alert on Impact
ImpactAlertOptions_VisualAlertEnable.description: When enabled, alerts the operator through the Display that an impact (above 'Full Logging Threshold') has been detected, logged and reported. The alert message remains on screen until the operator acknowledges it via button press.

ImpactAlertOptions_TimedOutput.title: Timed Output
ImpactAlertOptions_TimedOutput.description: When enabled, holds Buzzer Output (B06) high after impact detected, for duration specified by 'Timed Output Duration'. This feature may be used with an External Relay circuit to trigger an additional action on impact.

ImpactAlertOptions_ContinuousOutput.title: Continuous Output
ImpactAlertOptions_ContinuousOutput.description: When enabled, holds Buzzer Output (B06) high after impact detected, indefinitely until truck is shutdown. 'Continuous Output' overrides 'Timed Output' when both Features are active. This feature may be used with an External Relay circuit to trigger an additional action on impact.

ImpactTimedDuration.title: Timed Output Duration
ImpactTimedDuration.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the duration of the 'Timed Output' Impact alert feature.

VSM_TelemetrySubLevel.title: VSM Telemetry Subscription Level
VSM_TelemetrySubLevel.description: Units: Subscription Level. Specifies the VSM's telemetry subscription level.

oneOf.title: Off
oneOf.description: Telemetry is off. VSM will not communicate with the telemetry device

oneOf.title: Level1
oneOf.description: Telemetry set for level 1, monitor only

oneOf.title: Level2
oneOf.description: Telemetry set for level 2, ID reader access control

oneOf.title: Level3
oneOf.description: Telemetry set for level 3, Display with checklist and ID reader access control

CoAP_ServerIp.title: CoAP Server IP Address
CoAP_ServerIp.description: Units: IP Address or DNS name. Specifies the server end point address, as a numeric IP address or DNS name, of the Speedshield CoAP Server used for downloading/uploading device configuration files.

CoAP_ServerPort.title: CoAP Server Port Number
CoAP_ServerPort.description: Units: Port Number. Specifies the server port number of the Speedshield CoAP Server used for downloading/uploading device configuration files.

MQTT_ServerIp.title: MQTT Server IP Address
MQTT_ServerIp.description: Units: IP Address or DNS name. Specifies the server end point address, as a numeric IP address or DNS name, of the Speedshield MQTT Broker used for uploading device data.

MQTT_ServerPort.title: MQTT Server Port Number
MQTT_ServerPort.description: Units: Port Number. Specifies the server port number of the Speedshield MQTT Broker used for uploading device data.

MQTT_Username.title: MQTT Username
MQTT_Username.description: Units: Username. Specifies part of the credentials required to connect to the Speedshield MQTT Broker used for uploading device data.

MQTT_Password.title: MQTT Password
MQTT_Password.description: Units: Password. Specifies part of the credentials required to connect to the Speedshield MQTT Broker used for uploading device data.

MQTT_KeepAlive.title: MQTT Keep Alive Interval
MQTT_KeepAlive.description: Units: Keep Alive Interval. Specifies the MQTT keep alive interval to keep the connection active while there is no data to publish.

CellModem_Apn.title: Cellular Modem Access Point Name
CellModem_Apn.description: Units: string name. Specifies the APN (Access Point Name) used by the Cellular Modem to subscribe to data service on the cellular network.

CellModem_Username.title: Cellular Modem Username
CellModem_Username.description: Units: string name. Specifies the APN (Access Point Name) Username used by the Cellular Modem to subscribe to data service on the cellular network.

CellModem_Password.title: Cellular Modem Password
CellModem_Password.description: Units: string name. Specifies the APN (Access Point Name) Password used by the Cellular Modem to subscribe to data service on the cellular network.

ModemOptions_EmcTestMode.title: EMC Test Mode
ModemOptions_EmcTestMode.description: When enabled, puts the modem into a test mode where it registers on any network and accepts an incoming data call.

ModemOptions_PassThroughMode.title: Pass Through Mode
ModemOptions_PassThroughMode.description: When enabled, configures the modem to be controlled directly from the device's external RS232 port.

ModemOptions_FOTA.title: FOTA
ModemOptions_FOTA.description: When enabled, configures the modem to actively check for a modem firmware update.

ModemOptions_RSSI.title: RSSI
ModemOptions_RSSI.description: When enabled, configures the telemetry device to frequently read network signal strength.

CellModem_SimSlot.title: Cellular Modem SIM Slot
CellModem_SimSlot.description: Units: SIM Slot. Specifies which SIM card will be used for cellular network registration and data usage.

oneOf.title: Primary
oneOf.description: Selects primary slot only, regardless of whether SIM is present.

oneOf.title: Secondary
oneOf.description: Selects secondary slot only, regardless of whether SIM is present.

oneOf.title: PrimaryPreferred
oneOf.description: Selects primary slot if SIM is present, otherwise selects secondary slot.

oneOf.title: SecondaryPreferred
oneOf.description: Selects secondary slot if SIM is present, otherwise selects primary slot.

CellModem_RegistrationPolicy.title: Cellular Modem Registration Policy
CellModem_RegistrationPolicy.description: Units: Registration Policy. Specifies the network registration behaviour of the device's cellular modem.

oneOf.title: AutoMode
oneOf.description: Allow the modem to automatically decide which network to register with.

oneOf.title: LastUsedMode
oneOf.description: Attempt registration with previously registered network operator (that allowed data service). On failure perform full network search and attempt registration with each network operator from search results until registered with data service.

oneOf.title: PreferredMode
oneOf.description: Attempt registration with preferred network operator specified in settings configuration. On failure perform full network search and attempt registration with each network operator from search results until registered with data service.

oneOf.title: ManualSearchMode
oneOf.description: Perform full network search and attempt registration with each network operator from search results until registered with data service.

CellModem_PreferredAccessTech.title: Preferred Cellular Access Technology
CellModem_PreferredAccessTech.description: Units: Preferred Access Technology. Specifies the telemetry device's cell modem's preferred access technology method for network registration.

oneOf.title: Auto
oneOf.description: Allow the modem to automatically decide which access technology to use.

oneOf.title: 3G
oneOf.description: Prefer 3G data service.

oneOf.title: 4G
oneOf.description: Prefer 4G data service.

CellModem_PreferredAT.title: Preferred Cellular Access Technology
CellModem_PreferredAT.description: Units: Preferred Access Technology. Specifies the preferred access technology (used along with the preferred network operator) when using the preferred mode registration policy.

oneOf.title: 2G
oneOf.description: 2G data service is preferred.

oneOf.title: 3G
oneOf.description: 3G data service is preferred.

oneOf.title: 4G
oneOf.description: 4G data service is preferred.

CellModem_PreferredNetwork.title: Cellular Modem Preferred Network Operator ID
CellModem_PreferredNetwork.description: Units: MCC MNC. Specifies the preferred network operator when using the preferred mode registration policy. Value format is Mobile Country Code (3 digits) followed by Mobile Network Code / Operator (2 or 3 digits). Examples are 50501 for Telstra Australia and 310410 for AT&T USA. Refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code for the full list of mobile country codes.

ModemDisable.title: Modem Disable
ModemDisable.description: Units: boolean. When true disables the modem in the telemetry device, preventing telemetry data from being reported to the Portal. Otherwise when false, the modem is enabled and telemetry data is reported to the Portal as normal.

PrimaryModem.title: Primary Modem
PrimaryModem.description: Units: Primary Modem. Specifies which modem the device will use primarily for data transfer.

oneOf.title: WiFi 5G
oneOf.description: Requires a dedicated WiFi 5G telemetry device variant

ModemOnlineMode.title: Modem Online Mode
ModemOnlineMode.description: Units: Online Mode. Specifies the network connection mode for the device's modem.

WiFiModem_Ssid.title: Wi-Fi Modem SSID (Primary)
WiFiModem_Ssid.description: Units: string name. Specifies the particular Wi-Fi SSID or network name for the device to join and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_Password.title: Wi-Fi Modem Password (Primary)
WiFiModem_Password.description: Units: string name. Specifies the Wi-Fi network password used by the Wi-Fi Modem to join the network and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_Username.title: Wi-Fi Modem Username (Primary)
WiFiModem_Username.description: Units: string name. Specifies the Wi-Fi network username used by the Wi-Fi Modem to join the network and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_Bssid.title: Wi-Fi Modem BSSID (Primary)
WiFiModem_Bssid.description: Units: MAC Address as a hexadecimal string. Specifies the MAC address of the access point to join using the primary credentials. When non zero configures the telemetry device to only join with the specific access point with matching BSSID. This may be useful where multiple access points exist with the same SSID, and access to only one access point is preferred, or access to one access point is preferred over another.

WiFiModem_EapId.title: Wi-Fi Modem EAP Identity (Primary)
WiFiModem_EapId.description: Units: string name. Specifies the primary EAP identity that is used in PEAP and TTLS to hide the identity of the user while the TLS tunnel is configured. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_AuthType.title: Wi-Fi Modem Authentication Type (Primary)
WiFiModem_AuthType.description: Units: Auth Type. Specifies the Wi-Fi's modem authentication type. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

oneOf.title: Open
oneOf.description: Open network, no password required.

oneOf.title: PEAP
oneOf.description: EAP-PEAP-MSCHAPV2

oneOf.title: TTLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TTLS

oneOf.title: TLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TLS

WiFiModem_AuthMode.title: Wi-Fi Modem Authentication Mode (Primary)
WiFiModem_AuthMode.description: Units: Mode Type. Selects whether the telemetry device will use Client or Server Authentication for access to an Enterprise Network. The mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Server Authentication is specified, the device requires the server's CA certificate to authenticate the server. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

oneOf.title: Client Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Client Authentication is specified, the telemetry device does NOT authenticate the server.

oneOf.title: Server Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Server Authentication is specified, the telemetry device requires the server CA certificate to authenticate the server.

WiFiModem_SsidAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem SSID (Secondary)
WiFiModem_SsidAlt.description: Units: string name. Specifies the particular Wi-Fi SSID or network name for the device to join and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_PasswordAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem Password (Secondary)
WiFiModem_PasswordAlt.description: Units: string name. Specifies the Wi-Fi network password used by the Wi-Fi Modem to join the network and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_UsernameAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem Username (Secondary)
WiFiModem_UsernameAlt.description: Units: string name. Specifies the Wi-Fi network username used by the Wi-Fi Modem to join the network and transfer data. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_BssidAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem BSSID (Secondary)
WiFiModem_BssidAlt.description: Units: MAC Address as a hexadecimal string. Specifies the MAC address of the access point to join using the secondary credentials. When non zero configures the telemetry device to only join with the specific access point with matching BSSID. This may be useful where multiple access points exist with the same SSID, and access to only one access point is preferred, or access to one access point is preferred over another.

WiFiModem_EapIdAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem EAP Identity (Secondary)
WiFiModem_EapIdAlt.description: Units: string name. Specifies the secondary EAP identity that is used in PEAP and TTLS to hide the identity of the user while the TLS tunnel is configured. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

WiFiModem_AuthTypeAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem Authentication Type (Secondary)
WiFiModem_AuthTypeAlt.description: Units: Auth Type. Specifies the Wi-Fi's modem authentication type. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

oneOf.title: Open
oneOf.description: Open network, no password required.

oneOf.title: PEAP
oneOf.description: EAP-PEAP-MSCHAPV2

oneOf.title: TTLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TTLS

oneOf.title: TLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TLS

WiFiModem_AuthModeAlt.title: Wi-Fi Modem Authentication Mode (Secondary)
WiFiModem_AuthModeAlt.description: Units: Mode Type. Selects whether the telemetry device will use Client or Server Authentication for access to an Enterprise Network. The mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Server Authentication is specified, the device requires the server's CA certificate to authenticate the server. Note: Connection to the primary network is attempted first, then the secondary network and finally connection to the stored network is attempted. The 'Stored' Network is the last network over which the device was able to reach and synchronise data with the Telemetry Server.

oneOf.title: Client Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Client Authentication is specified, the telemetry device does NOT authenticate the server.

oneOf.title: Server Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Server Authentication is specified, the telemetry device requires the server CA certificate to authenticate the server.

WiFiModem_ProxyOption.title: Proxy Option
WiFiModem_ProxyOption.description: Units: Proxy Option. Specifies whether the Wi-Fi's modem will connect to the Speedshield Servers via the specified Proxy Ip Address and Proxy port.

WiFiModem_ProxyServerIp.title: Proxy Server IP Address
WiFiModem_ProxyServerIp.description: Units: IP address as numeric IP or DNS name. Specifies the IP Address of the Proxy Server that the device will tunnel through to reach the Speedshield Servers.

WiFiModem_ProxyServerPort.title: Proxy Server Port Number
WiFiModem_ProxyServerPort.description: Units: Port Number. Specifies the port number of the Proxy Server that the device will tunnel through to reach the Speedshield Servers.

WiFiModem_IpMethod.title: IP Address Assignment Method
WiFiModem_IpMethod.description: Units: IP Assignment Method. Specifies whether the Wi-Fi's modem will connect to the Speedshield Servers via the specified Proxy Ip Address and Proxy port.

oneOf.title: DHCP
oneOf.description: The telemetry device's IP Assignment occurs automatically via the DHCP Server on connected WiFi Network.

oneOf.title: Static IP
oneOf.description: The telemetry device's IP Address is assigned manually via the Static IP Address settings. Static IP, Subnet Mask and Gateway Address must all be configured appropriately.

WiFiModem_StaticIp.title: Static IP Address
WiFiModem_StaticIp.description: Units: Numeric IP Address (IPv4). Specifies the IP address of the telemetry device when the IP assignment option is set to 'Static IP'.

WiFiModem_StaticSubnetMask.title: Static Subnet Mask
WiFiModem_StaticSubnetMask.description: Units: Numeric IP Address (IPv4). Specifies the Subnet Mask of the telemetry device when the IP assignment option is set to 'Static IP'.

WiFiModem_StaticGatewayIp.title: Static Gateway IP Address
WiFiModem_StaticGatewayIp.description: Units: Numeric IP Address (IPv4). Specifies the Gateway IP address of the telemetry device when the IP assignment option is set to 'Static IP'.

WiFiModem_DnsServerIp.title: Static DNS Server IP Address
WiFiModem_DnsServerIp.description: Units: Numeric IP Address (IPv4). Specifies the DNS Server's IP Address of the WiFi Network the telemetry device is intending to join. This field is required  when the IP assignment option is set to 'Static IP'.

WiFiModem_Band.title: WiFi Band Selection
WiFiModem_Band.description: Units: Band. Specifies frequency band selection for the telemetry device's internal Wi-Fi modem. Applies to 5GHz Wi-Fi specific variants of the VAM only.

oneOf.title: 2_4GHz and 5GHz
oneOf.description: Specifies dual mode, Wi-Fi modem will scan for and join networks on both 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequency bands.

oneOf.title: 2_4GHz Only
oneOf.description: Specifies 2.4GHz only, Wi-Fi modem will scan for and join networks only on the 2.4GHz frequency band.

oneOf.title: 5GHz Only
oneOf.description: Specifies 5GHz only, Wi-Fi modem will scan for and join networks only on the 5GHz frequency band.

ConnectWindowEnable.title: Connect Window Feature Enable
ConnectWindowEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true enables the Connect Window feature, which essentially only allows radio communications during a specified time window. This feature should only be enabled for customers that place restrictions on radio communications.

ConnectWindowTrigger.title: Connect Window Trigger
ConnectWindowTrigger.description: Units: Trigger Options. Specifies the trigger to apply the connect window feature, which essentially only allows radio communications during a specified time window.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: No Connect Window Trigger is set. Connect Window feature is therefore disabled. Telemetry data reporting is unrestricted.

oneOf.title: Checklist
oneOf.description: Specifies that the Connect Window feature begins at the start of the Pre-Start Checklist. Checklist scheduling frequency will therefore determine device's Telemetry Server connection schedule.

ConnectWindowDuration.title: Connect Window Duration
ConnectWindowDuration.description: Units: Minutes. Specifies the duration of the Connect Window i.e. the period of time where the device can report Telemetry Data. This field only applies when the Connect Window feature is enabled.

DeviceSleepMode.title: Device Sleep Mode
DeviceSleepMode.description: Units: Sleep Mode. Specifies the device's sleep mode.

DeviceTestMode.title: Device Test Mode
DeviceTestMode.description: Units: Test Mode. Specifies whether the device is currently in test mode or not.

MQTT_QoS.title: MQTT Quality of Service
MQTT_QoS.description: Units: QoS. Specifies the QoS (Quality of Service) for the device's connection to the MQTT Broker.

GpsLoggingOption.title: GPS Logging Option
GpsLoggingOption.description: Units: GPS Logging Option. Specifies the mode in which to record and report GPS position.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Disables GPS event logging. When selected, GPS position is NOT reported to the Portal.

oneOf.title: Start and Stop
oneOf.description: Reports GPS Position at the start and end of each drive session.

oneOf.title: Every Interval
oneOf.description: Reports GPS Position periodically at intervals specified by the GPS logging interval setting.

GpsLoggingInterval.title: GPS Logging Interval
GpsLoggingInterval.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the interval at which GPS position is record and reported to the Portal. Only applies when 'Every Interval' is selected as the GPS logging option.

AssetTimeout_NoKey.title: No Key Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_NoKey.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, once the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's Key/Ignition has remained off since access was granted. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeout_KeyOff.title: Key Off Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_KeyOff.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, once the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's Key/Ignition has been switched off.

AssetTimeout_NoOperatorAccess.title: Operator Access Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_NoOperatorAccess.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, while waiting for operator login after system wakeup. This timeout must be between 5 seconds and 1 hour otherwise the default setting value will be used instead.

AssetTimeout_Unattended.title: Unattended Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_Unattended.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck is unattended, operator is no longer present. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access. This timeout must be between 5 seconds and 1 hour otherwise the default setting value will be used instead.

AssetTimeout_NoOperation.title: No Operation Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_NoOperation.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck is not being operated. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access. This timeout must be between 5 seconds and 1 hour otherwise the default setting value will be used instead.

AssetTimeout_EngineOff.title: Engine Off Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_EngineOff.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's engine is not running but Ignition remains on. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeout_OperatorLogOff.title: Operator Log Off Asset Timeout
AssetTimeout_OperatorLogOff.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time delay before the Asset/Truck is shutdown, after the telemetry device detects the Operator intends to log off the Asset/Truck, i.e. Ignition is off and operator is not longer present. This timeout does not apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_NoKey.title: No Key Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_NoKey.description: Units: Boolean. Enables No Key Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown once the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's Key/Ignition has remained off since access was granted after 'No Key Asset Timeout' delay. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_KeyOff.title: Key Off Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_KeyOff.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Key Off Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown once the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's Key/Ignition has been switched off.

AssetTimeoutEnable_NoOperatorAccess.title: Operator Access Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_NoOperatorAccess.description: Units: Boolean. Enables No Operator Access Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown while waiting for operator login after system wakeup.

AssetTimeoutEnable_Unattended.title: Unattended Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_Unattended.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Unattended Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck is unattended, operator is no longer present. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_NoOperation.title: No Operation Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_NoOperation.description: Units: Boolean. Enables No Operation Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck is not being operated. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_EngineOff.title: Engine Off Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_EngineOff.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Engine Off Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects the Asset/Truck's engine is not running but Ignition remains on. This timeout does not apply during ID Reader/Checklist/SeatBelt interlocks, nor does it apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_OperatorLogOff.title: Operator Log Off Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_OperatorLogOff.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Operator Log Off Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects the Operator intends to log off the Asset/Truck, i.e. Ignition is off and operator is not longer present. This timeout does not apply for technician or higher level access.

AssetTimeoutEnable_ChecklistNoResponse.title: Checklist No Response Shutdown
AssetTimeoutEnable_ChecklistNoResponse.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Checklist No Response Asset Timeout. Triggers Asset/Truck shutdown after the telemetry device detects no response to a checklist question for longer than the timeout period.

AssetTimeout_TechAccess.title: Asset Timeouts with Technician Access
AssetTimeout_TechAccess.description: Units: Asset Timeout Technician Access Option. Specifies whether asset timeouts apply when logged on with Technician or higher level access.

oneOf.title: Timeouts Disabled
oneOf.description: Specifies that the majority of asset timeouts are disabled when logged in with technician or higher level access. Only 'Key Off', 'No Operator Access' and 'No Operator Log Off' Timeouts still apply. This option is most commonly used as it allows Mechanics / Technicians to work on the truck without the telemetry system interfering and shutting down the truck.

oneOf.title: Regular Timeouts Apply
oneOf.description: Specifies that when logged on with Technician or higher level access, there is no change to the asset timeouts, the same asset timeouts apply as those under Operator Level Access.

AlertOptions_BuzzOnWake.title: Buzz On Wake
AlertOptions_BuzzOnWake.description: When true, device will sound one single long buzz on wake.

AlertOptions_BuzzOnId.title: Buzz On ID Swipe
AlertOptions_BuzzOnId.description: When true, device will sound an alert after ID Swipe or Pin Code entered. Device sounds one single long buzz on Access Granted, otherwise device sounds two or three short buzzes on Access Denied.

AlertOptions_BuzzOnTimeout.title: Buzz On Timeout
AlertOptions_BuzzOnTimeout.description: When true, device will sound an alert when Asset/Truck shutdown is imminent. Device sounds one short buzz every 5 seconds when shutdown is within 30 seconds, and one short buzz every second when shutdown is within 10 seconds.

AlertOptions_BuzzOnIdReady.title: Buzz On ID Ready
AlertOptions_BuzzOnIdReady.description: When true, device will sound an alert when system is ready to accept swipe and/or pin entry.

ModuleWakeup.description: Defines module wake-ups from pin input signals.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin2.title: GreyPin 2
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin2.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 2 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 2.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin3.title: GreyPin 3
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin3.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 3 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 3.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin4.title: GreyPin 4
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin4.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 4 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 4.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin5.title: GreyPin 5
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin5.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 5 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 5.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin6.title: GreyPin 6
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin6.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 6 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 6.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin7.title: GreyPin 7
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin7.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 7 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 7.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin8.title: GreyPin 8
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin8.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 8 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 8.

ModuleWakeup_GreyPin9.title: GreyPin 9
ModuleWakeup_GreyPin9.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Grey Pin 9 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Grey Pin 9.

ModuleWakeup_BlackPin2.title: BlackPin 2
ModuleWakeup_BlackPin2.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Black Pin 2 Wakeup (Relay 1 Common line). Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Black Pin 2.

ModuleWakeup_BlackPin4.title: BlackPin 4
ModuleWakeup_BlackPin4.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Black Pin 4 Wakeup (Relay 2 Common line). Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Black Pin 4.

ModuleWakeup_BlackPin12.title: BlackPin 12
ModuleWakeup_BlackPin12.description: Units: Boolean. Enables Black Pin 12 Wakeup. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a signal on Black Pin 12.

ModuleWakeup_High.title: Module Wakeup High
ModuleWakeup_High.description: Defines module wake-ups from low power mode for rising edge or 12+V level pin input signals.

ModuleWakeup_Low.title: Module Wakeup Low
ModuleWakeup_Low.description: Defines module wake-ups from low power mode for falling edge or 0V level pin input signals.

ModuleWakeup_General.title: Module Wakeup General
ModuleWakeup_General.description: Defines module wake-ups from sources other than the digital pin inputs.

ModuleWakeupGeneral_CanMain.title: CAN Main
ModuleWakeupGeneral_CanMain.description: Units: Boolean. Enables wakeup from activity on the Main CAN Bus. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a CAN frame received on Grey Pin 10 and 11.

ModuleWakeupGeneral_CanAux.title: CAN Aux
ModuleWakeupGeneral_CanAux.description: Units: Boolean. Enables wakeup from activity on the Aux CAN Bus. Telemetry Device is triggered to wakeup from a CAN frame received on Black Pin 9 and 10.

RelayControl.title: Relay Control
RelayControl.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays for one particular system state.

RelayControl_OpenRelay1.title: Open Relay 1
RelayControl_OpenRelay1.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies that the contacts for relay 1 will be open in the associated system state. Relay 1 is internal to the VAM Module and the contacts are pinned to Black Pin 1 and 2.

RelayControl_OpenRelay2.title: Open Relay 2
RelayControl_OpenRelay2.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies that the contacts for relay 2 will be open in the associated system state. Relay 2 is internal to the VAM Module and the contacts are pinned to Black Pin 3 and 4.

RelayControl_CloseRelay1.title: Close Relay 1
RelayControl_CloseRelay1.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies that the contacts for relay 1 will be closed in the associated system state. Relay 1 is internal to the VAM Module and the contacts are pinned to Black Pin 1 and 2.

RelayControl_CloseRelay2.title: Close Relay 2
RelayControl_CloseRelay2.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies that the contacts for relay 2 will be closed in the associated system state. Relay 2 is internal to the VAM Module and the contacts are pinned to Black Pin 3 and 4.

RelayControl_OnWakeup.title: On Wakeup
RelayControl_OnWakeup.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays immediately after system wakeup. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnAccess.title: On Access Granted
RelayControl_OnAccess.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays after operator login, i.e. operator has passed ID reader interlock for the Asset/Truck. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnStart.title: On Allowed Start
RelayControl_OnStart.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays once the Asset/Truck is allowed to start, i.e. all pre-start interlocks are completed. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnStartTimeout.title: On Allowed Start Delay
RelayControl_OnStartTimeout.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays after a specified delay after Asset/Truck is allowed to start, i.e. all pre-start interlocks are completed. Delay is specified by RelayControl_StartTimeout setting. If no relay options are enabled or the specified timeout is zero, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnShutdown.title: On Shutdown
RelayControl_OnShutdown.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays during Asset/Truck shutdown, i.e. timeout has occurred and telemetry device is enforcing Asset/Truck shutdown. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnShutdownTimeout.title: On Shutdown Delay
RelayControl_OnShutdownTimeout.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays after a specified delay after Asset/Truck shutdown. Delay is specified by RelayControl_ShutdownTimeout setting. If no relay options are enabled or the specified timeout is zero, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_OnCommsShutdown.title: On Comms Shutdown Delay
RelayControl_OnCommsShutdown.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays after CAN communication ceases and the specified delay elapses after Asset/Truck shutdown. Delay is specified by RelayControl_CommsShutdownTimeout setting. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_SeatBelt.title: Seat Belt Truck Disable
RelayControl_SeatBelt.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays while seat belt violation is active. Only applies when seat belt truck disable feature is enabled. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_Checklist.title: Checklist Asset Disable
RelayControl_Checklist.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays during the post-start checklist after a period of no response. Only applies when checklist no response asset disabled feature is enabled. Once the operator responds to the current post-start checklist question the relays revert back to their original state. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_Overload.title: Overload Truck Disable
RelayControl_Overload.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays while Asset/Truck is overloaded. Only applies when overload truck disable feature is enabled. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_ParkBrake.title: Park Brake Truck Disable
RelayControl_ParkBrake.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays while park brake violation is active. Only applies when park brake truck disable feature is enabled. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

RelayControl_StartTimeout.title: Allowed Start Delay
RelayControl_StartTimeout.description: Units: 100 ms/bit. Sets the time delay after Asset/Truck is allowed to start before the relay state is changed by RelayControl_OnStartTimeout setting. Timeout does not apply when value is set to zero.

RelayControl_ShutdownTimeout.title: Shutdown Delay
RelayControl_ShutdownTimeout.description: Units: 100 ms/bit. Sets the time delay after system shutdown before the relay state is changed by RelayControl_OnShutdownTimeout setting. Timeout does not apply when value is set to zero.

RelayControl_CommsShutdownTimeout.title: Comms Shutdown Delay
RelayControl_CommsShutdownTimeout.description: Units: 100 ms/bit. Sets the time delay after system shutdown AND CAN communications ceases before the relay state is changed by RelayControl_OnCommsShutdown setting. Timeout does not apply when value is set to zero.

InternalConfigName.title: Internal Settings Configuration Name
InternalConfigName.description: Units: string name. Used by the system to specify the name of the base settings file that was loaded into the device during installation. This name gives the user feedback / confirmation that a particular version of a base settings file was loaded.

zzSysMemCtrl.title: System Memory Control
zzSysMemCtrl.description: Provides options for deleting retained fields from telemetry device's memory. DO NOT USE, unless specifically instructed to by Telemetry Support/Admin Staff.

SysMemCtrl_ClearEvents.title: Clear Event Storage
SysMemCtrl_ClearEvents.description: Units: Boolean. When true triggers the telemetry device to delete current event storage. Any events currently stored and not yet sent to the server will be deleted.

SysMemCtrl_ClearLockout.title: Clear Lockout
SysMemCtrl_ClearLockout.description: Units: Boolean. When true triggers the telemetry device to clear it's lockout status, without the need for swiping a card.

SysMemCtrl_ClearWiFi.title: Clear Last WiFi Credentials
SysMemCtrl_ClearWiFi.description: Units: Boolean. When true triggers the telemetry device to clear the WiFi network credentials stored on the last successful Event/Config Sync.

SysMemCtrl_ClearBT.title: Clear BT Pairing/Operators
SysMemCtrl_ClearBT.description: Units: Boolean. When true triggers the telemetry device to clear its stored Bluetooth pairing associations and its bluetooth device - Card ID associations.

LogMsg_DebugLevel.title: Log Message Event Debug Level
LogMsg_DebugLevel.description: Units: Log Level. Specifies the debug logging level, used by the telemetry device when remotely reporting diagnostics.

TelemApp.title: Telemetry Application
TelemApp.description: Units: application type. Specifies which telemetry application the telemetry device is configured for.

items.description: Input Mapper in serialised binary form.

TruckLimit_Enable.title: Performance Limit Enable
TruckLimit_Enable.description: Units: boolean. When true enables the operator performance limit feature, which limits Asset's/Truck's max speed and for some models lift speed, based on operator's access profile.

TruckLimit_ReducedEnable.title: Reduced Limit Enable
TruckLimit_ReducedEnable.description: Units: boolean. When true enables the reduced limit feature within the operator performance limit feature, which reduces an Asset's/Truck's max speed and for some models lift speed, after an impact or when creep mode is active.

zzTruckLimit_Options.title: Performance Limit Options
zzTruckLimit_Options.description: Sets the state of the VAM Module relays after CAN communication ceases and the specified delay elapses after Asset/Truck shutdown. Delay is specified by RelayControl_CommsShutdownTimeout setting. If no relay options are enabled, the relay state does not change.

TruckLimit_Options_Percent.title: Percent
TruckLimit_Options_Percent.description: Units: Boolean. When true interprets Truck Speed Limits as percentage (by default Speed Limits are absolute). Does not apply Multiplier/Divider Conversions. Required for certain truck models that don't follow truck control specification.

TruckLimit_Options_ObjectDetect.title: Object Detect
TruckLimit_Options_ObjectDetect.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies performance limit feature to use object detection control message, specifying truck speed limits directly. Used for both Electric Rider Class 1 and 1-8Ton Class 4 and 5 trucks. Note: 1-8Ton trucks require a conversion factor of x128 /10.

TruckSpeedLimit_Novice.title: Novice Truck Speed
TruckSpeedLimit_Novice.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Truck speed performance limit based on Asset/Truck operator's access profile.

TruckLimit_Speed2.title: Intermediate Truck Speed
TruckLimit_Speed2.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Truck speed performance limit based on Asset/Truck operator's access profile.

TruckLimit_Speed3.title: Advanced Truck Speed
TruckLimit_Speed3.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Truck speed performance limit based on Asset/Truck operator's access profile.

TruckLimit_SpeedCreep.title: Creep Mode Truck Speed
TruckLimit_SpeedCreep.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Truck speed performance limit while 'Creep' mode is active.

TruckLimit_SpeedImpact.title: Impact Truck Speed
TruckLimit_SpeedImpact.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Truck speed performance limit after a significant impact has occurred.

TruckLimit_Multi.title: Truck Speed Multiplier
TruckLimit_Multi.description: Units: Scale Factor. Multiplier conversion factor applied to truck speed limit before transmitting to truck controller. Required for certain truck models that don't follow truck control specification. Multiplier is applied before Divider.

TruckLimit_Div.title: Truck Speed Divider
TruckLimit_Div.description: Units: Scale Factor. Divider conversion factor applied to truck speed limit before transmitting to truck controller. Required for certain truck models that don't follow truck control specification. Multiplier is applied before Divider.

TruckLimit_SpeedMax.title: Max Truck Speed
TruckLimit_SpeedMax.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. A maximum speed limit applied when operator performance limit feature is enabled but the ID reader is disabled or wire guidance status is active or no profile is defined.

TruckLimit_Lift1.title: Novice Lift Speed
TruckLimit_Lift1.description: Units: Percent Enum. Truck lift speed performance limit, based on operator's access profile. Setting range is from 0 to 5, and 0 means 0%, 1 means 20%, 2 means 40%, 3 means 60%, 4 means 80% and 5 means 100%.

TruckLimit_Lift2.title: Intermediate Lift Speed
TruckLimit_Lift2.description: Units: Percent Enum. Truck lift speed performance limit, based on operator's access profile. Setting range is from 0 to 5, and 0 means 0%, 1 means 20%, 2 means 40%, 3 means 60%, 4 means 80% and 5 means 100%.

TruckLimit_Lift3.title: Advanced Lift Speed
TruckLimit_Lift3.description: Units: Percent Enum. Truck lift speed performance limit, based on operator's access profile. Setting range is from 0 to 5, and 0 means 0%, 1 means 20%, 2 means 40%, 3 means 60%, 4 means 80% and 5 means 100%.

TruckLimit_LiftCreep.title: Creep Mode Lift Speed
TruckLimit_LiftCreep.description: Units: Percent Enum. Truck lift speed performance limit while 'Creep' mode is active. Setting range is from 0 to 5, and 0 means 0%, 1 means 20%, 2 means 40%, 3 means 60%, 4 means 80% and 5 means 100%.

TruckLimit_LiftImpact.title: Impact Lift Speed
TruckLimit_LiftImpact.description: Units: Percent Enum. Truck lift speed performance limit after a significant impact has occurred. Setting range is from 0 to 5, and 0 means 0%, 1 means 20%, 2 means 40%, 3 means 60%, 4 means 80% and 5 means 100%.

InterlockBypassRPM.title: Interlock Bypass RPM
InterlockBypassRPM.description: Units: RPM. Specifies an Engine RPM threshold that can trigger the system to bypass or skip ID and Checklist interlocks. If the telemetry module detects Engine RPM over this threshold during the ID Interlock stage, the telemetry module will skip interlocks and continue to log and report the drive session. This feature is disabled when the RPM threshold is set to zero.

SafeSpeedShutdown.title: Safe Speed Shutdown
SafeSpeedShutdown.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies a Speed Threshold under which the truck may be shutdown from an event such as impact. This feature is disabled when set to zero, and instead the default shutdown speed threshold is used.

FuelBattEnable.title: Fuel/Battery Level Reporting Option
FuelBattEnable.description: Units: Option. Specifies whether fuel/battery level is reported.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Fuel/Battery level is not reported.

oneOf.title: On Session Start and End
oneOf.description: Fuel/Battery level is reported at the start and end of the Asset/Truck drive session.

oneOf.title: Every Interval
oneOf.description: Fuel/Battery level is reported at the start and end of the Asset/Truck drive session and periodically every interval specified by the Level Recording Rate setting.

FuelBattRecordRate.title: Level Recording Rate
FuelBattRecordRate.description: Units: Minutes. Specifies the rate at which the current Fuel/Battery level is logged.

FuelBattLowThres.title: Level Low Threshold
FuelBattLowThres.description: Units: Percentage. Specifies the Fuel/Battery level below which the Asset/Truck's Fuel Battery Level is considered low.

FuelBattLowHys.title: Level Low Hysteresis
FuelBattLowHys.description: Units: Percentage. Specifies the Hysteresis value for detecting and immediately reporting low Fuel/Battery level.

FuelBattFilterOption.title: Level Filter Option
FuelBattFilterOption.description: Units: Option. Specifies whether fuel/battery level is reported.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Fuel/Battery level input is not internally modified is not reported, rather the input is directly reported to the telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Fuel/Battery level is internally filtered before being reported to the telemetry server. The filter operates on the Fuel/Battery raw input, overwriting the regular Fuel/Battery input. Filtering starts once Ignition is active.

FuelBattFilterSize.title: Filter Window Size
FuelBattFilterSize.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the time period over which the Fuel/Battery level is filtered.

FuelBattAlertOptions_Buzz.title: Buzz On Low Fuel/Battery Level
FuelBattAlertOptions_Buzz.description: When true, while Fuel/Battery level is below threshold, an audible alert is raised prompting operator to attention.

FuelBattAlertOptions_Visual.title: Visual Alert On Low Fuel/Battery Level
FuelBattAlertOptions_Visual.description: When true, while Fuel/Battery level is below threshold, a visual alert is raised on the Telemetry Display prompting operator to attention.

FuelBattAlertPeriod.title: Level Alert Period
FuelBattAlertPeriod.description: Units: Minutes. Specifies the period interval between alerts. A value of zero means once per session.

BMSessionDuration.description: Units: Seconds. Specifies the duration period that the Battery Monitor Session Event is summarized over and reported.

BMIdleCurrentTolerance.title: Discharge Current Threshold
BMIdleCurrentTolerance.description: Units: 0.0625 A/Bit. Indicates the current threshold over which the device's battery telemetry logic considers the Asset's/Truck's battery as being discharged.

BMChargeCurrentThreshold.title: Charge Current Threshold
BMChargeCurrentThreshold.description: Units: 0.0625 A/Bit. Indicates the current threshold over which the device's battery telemetry logic considers the Asset's/Truck's battery as being charged.

BMChargeEndDelay.title: Charge End Delay
BMChargeEndDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the minimum duration that current stops flowing into the battery before the telemetry device considers the Asset's/Truck's battery no longer in charge. Used for alternate charge detection logic to the direct 'charger connected' status.

BMMinStateChangeDelay.title: Discharge Delay
BMMinStateChangeDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the minimum duration that the device's battery telemetry logic will consider the Asset's/Truck's battery in discharge.

BMChargeStateDelay.title: Charge Start Delay
BMChargeStateDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the minimum duration that current is being delivered to the battery before the telemetry device considers the Asset's/Truck's battery in charge. Used for alternate charge detection logic to the direct 'charger connected' status.

BMTempDetectOption.title: Over/Under Temp Detection Option
BMTempDetectOption.description: Units: Option. Specifies how the telemetry device should detect and report over/under temperature events.

oneOf.title: Temp Only
oneOf.description: Logic uses over/under temperature thresholds only (ignoring thermal derate) to trigger over/under temperature event logging.

oneOf.title: Derate or Temp
oneOf.description: Logic uses thermal derate OR over/under temperature thresholds, either condition can trigger over/under temperature event logging.

BMDerateThresh.title: Thermal Derate Threshold
BMDerateThresh.description: Units: Percent. Specifies the thermal derate threshold used to trigger over/under temperature events. Where zero means truck has full performance and 100 means truck has minimum or no performance.

BMOverTempThreshold.description: Units: 1 DegC/Bit. Indicates the temperature threshold over which the device's battery telemetry logic will consider the Asset's/Truck's battery over temperature. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the over temperature occurrence. A value of -128 indicates over temperature sensing is disabled.

BMOverTempHysteresis.description: Units: 1 DegC/Bit. Indicates the temperature hysteresis value used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset's/Truck's battery is over temperature. The device will consider the Battery over temperature until the battery's temperature falls below the threshold temperature plus the hysteresis value. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the over temperature occurrence.

BMOverTempDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the time delay used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset's/Truck's battery is over temperature. The device will only consider the Battery over temperature when the temperature exceeds the threshold for a duration exceeding the time delay value. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the over temperature occurrence.

BMLowTempThreshold.description: Units: 1 DegC/Bit. Indicates the temperature threshold under which the device's battery telemetry logic will consider the Asset's/Truck's battery under temperature. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the under temperature occurrence. A value of -128 indicates under temperature sensing is disabled.

BMLowTempHysteresis.description: Units: 1 DegC/Bit. Indicates the temperature hysteresis value used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset's/Truck's battery is under temperature. The device will consider the Battery under temperature until the battery's temperature rises above the threshold temperature plus the hysteresis value. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the under temperature occurrence.

BMLowTempDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the time delay used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset's/Truck's battery is under temperature. The device will only consider the Battery under temperature when the temperature falls below the threshold for a duration exceeding the time delay value. The device uses the temperature threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the under temperature occurrence.

BMLowSoCThreshold.description: Units: Percent. Indicates the state of charge threshold under which the device's battery telemetry logic will consider the Asset/Truck battery's state of charge low. The device uses the low state of charge threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the low state of charge occurrence.

BMLowSoCHysteresis.description: Units: Percent. Indicates the state of charge hysteresis value used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset/Truck battery's state of charge is low. The device will consider the Battery's state of charge low until the battery's state of charge rises above the threshold plus the hysteresis value. The device uses the low state of charge threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the low state of charge occurrence.

BMLowSoCDelay.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the time delay used for the calculation logic to determine whether the Asset/Truck battery's state of charge is low. The device will only consider the Battery's state of charge low when the state of charge falls below the threshold for a duration exceeding the time delay value. The device uses the low state of charge threshold, hysteresis and time delay values to trigger recording/reporting of the low state of charge occurrence.

BMEnable.description: Units: Boolean. When true specifies that lithium ion battery monitoring and reporting will occur, otherwise battery monitoring is disabled.

BMRawInputTimeout.description: Units: 100ms/bit. Indicates the time delay after the last Battery Data CAN Message has been received before battery monitoring accumulations/calculations are stopped.

BMCurrentCoefficient.title: Current Coefficient
BMCurrentCoefficient.description: Units: Current Coefficient. Specifies the direction of current flow in/out of the Asset's/Truck's battery. By default, positive current indicates charging, and negative current indicates Asset/Truck usage.

BMBatteryCapacityAh.description: Units: Ah. Indicates the capacity of the Asset's/Truck's battery. Used for battery monitoring calculations for CCF and AhRemaining.

BMCCFBufferEntries.description: Units: Entries. Indicates the number of entries in the buffer used by the battery monitoring CCF (Continuous Charge Factor) calculation.

BMCCFBufferSeconds.description: Units: Seconds. Indicates the charge/usage time in seconds for each buffer entry used by the battery monitoring CCF (Continuous Charge Factor) calculation.

ConfigMenuPassword.title: FM2 Config Menu Button Password
ConfigMenuPassword.description: Units: Button sequence, allowed characters LRudlr. Specifies the button sequence required to enter the FM2 on screen configuration menu. All six buttons may be used in the button sequence, i.e. the Left and Right circle buttons and the four middle arrow buttons. Use lower case characters l r u d for the centre arrow buttons Left Right Up and Down. Use upper case characters L and R for the Left and Right circle buttons. The custom button sequence must have a minimum of 4 characters. If a custom button sequence is not specified or the button sequence is invalid the default button sequence will be used. NOTE: The field Config Menu Enable Options controls whether the Configuration Menu is accessible.

RemoveLockoutPassword.title: FM2 Remove Lockout Button Password
RemoveLockoutPassword.description: Units: Button sequence, allowed characters LRudlr. Specifies the button sequence required to enter the FM2 on screen Remove Lockout Menu. All six buttons may be used in the button sequence, i.e. the Left and Right circle buttons and the four middle arrow buttons. Use lower case characters l r u d for the centre arrow buttons Left Right Up and Down. Use upper case characters L and R for the Left and Right circle buttons. The custom button sequence must have a minimum of 4 characters. If a custom button sequence is not specified or the button sequence is invalid the default button sequence will be used. NOTE: The field Config Menu Enable Options controls whether the Remove Lockout Menu is accessible.

FaultVerifiedRME.title: Fault Verified Through RME
FaultVerifiedRME.description: Units: Log Level. Specifies the whether faults are to be verified through RME, allowing automatic notification to service vendors.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Faults are not verified through RME.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Faults must be verified through RME, allowing automatic notification to service vendors.

NotifyVendorTimeout.title: Notify Vendor Timeout
NotifyVendorTimeout.description: Units: Minutes. Specifies the maximum wait time for the service notification request to be sent to the Asset / Truck vendor through the telemetry server. When time is exceeded, telemetry device will continue to attempt sending this request in the background, but truck will timeout/shutdown and remain out of service.

OAS.title: Operator Assist System
OAS.description: Units: OAS Control. Specifies whether telemetry enables or disables the Operator Assist System on the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: No Change
oneOf.description: Do NOT change the Operator Assist System, no commands will be sent to change or adjust the OAS system.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Enable the Operator Assist System on the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Disable the Operator Assist System on the Asset / Truck.

OASAlt1.title: OAS Alt Mode 1
OASAlt1.description: Units: OAS Alt Mode Option. Specifies the Operator Assist System Alt Mode option for the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: OAS Alt Mode disabled.

OASAlt2.title: OAS Alt Mode 2
OASAlt2.description: Units: OAS Alt Mode Option. Specifies the Operator Assist System Alt Mode option for the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: OAS Alt Mode disabled.

OASAlt3.title: OAS Alt Mode 3
OASAlt3.description: Units: OAS Alt Mode Option. Specifies the Operator Assist System Alt Mode option for the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: OAS Alt Mode disabled.

OASAlt4.title: OAS Alt Mode 4
OASAlt4.description: Units: OAS Alt Mode Option. Specifies the Operator Assist System Alt Mode option for the Asset / Truck.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: OAS Alt Mode disabled.

UtilLogging.title: Utilisation Logging Option
UtilLogging.description: Units: Utilisation Logging Option. Controls whether or not Utilisation events are logged and reported to the telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: Utilisation events are NOT logged and therefore NOT reported to the Portal.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: Utilisation events are logged and reported at the rate specified by the event logging interval.

UtilInterval.title: Utilisation Logging Interval
UtilInterval.description: Units: Minutes. Specifies the interval at which Utilisation events are logged and reported to the Portal.

Can232Monitor.title: CAN232 Monitoring
Can232Monitor.description: Units: Can232 Monitor Option. Controls whether or not CAN232 Adapter communicatons are monitored and whether action is taken to reset adapter when regular messages arent being received.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: CAN232 Adapter communications are not monitored and no action is taken to reset the adapter.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: CAN232 Adapter communications are monitored, if expected messages aren't being regularly received, CAN232 Adapter is reset via on board relay (B03/B04).

RecallChecklistOption.title: Recall Checklist Option
RecallChecklistOption.description: Units: Recall Checklist Option. Controls whether the checklist recalled by the operator mid-session contains the pre/post start checklist questions or a entirely new set of questions.

oneOf.title: Pre Post Checklist
oneOf.description: The checklist recalled by the operator mid-session contains the pre/post start checklist questions.

oneOf.title: In Session Checklist
oneOf.description: The checklist recalled by the operator mid-session contains an entirely new set of checklist questions - the in-session checklist questions.

InterlockBypassGeneral.title: Interlock Bypass Detect
InterlockBypassGeneral.description: Enables the general interlock bypass detection feature. Allows the system to detect when the interlock has been bypassed based on truck activity determined by the general interlock bypass input. This enable is separate to the interlock bypass RPM feature.

RestrictPreProgrammedTechCard.title: Restrict PreProgrammed Tech Card
RestrictPreProgrammedTechCard.description: Units: PreProgrammed Tech Option. Specifies how the pre-programmed tech card is treated by the system.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: VAM will grant access to pre-programmed tech card even when card number is not included on operator list.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: VAM will treat pre programmed tech cards as normal operator cards, and will only be granted access when card number is included on operator list.

VipEnable.title: VIP Terminal Enable
VipEnable.description: Units: Utilisation Logging Option. Controls whether or not Utilisation events are logged and reported to the telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Disabled
oneOf.description: The VIP Terminal RS232 Interface is disabled.

oneOf.title: Enabled
oneOf.description: The VIP Terminal RS232 Interface is enabled.

VipInterval.title: VIP Live Data Interval
VipInterval.description: Units: ms. Sets the frequency of live data transmissions over the VIP Terminal RS232 interface.

EarlyExitSpeedThreshold.title: Early Exit Speed Threshold
EarlyExitSpeedThreshold.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Speed threshold used for the early exit detection and reporting feature, which detects if the operator exits the Asset/Truck while its still moving.

CS_RefId.description: Numeric reference ID of the sensor input to monitor.

CS_Type.description: Specifies the logging and alert behaviour of the associated sensor input.

oneOf.title: StateChange
oneOf.description: Sensor value is reported on every state change and at the start and end of the drive session.

oneOf.title: CriticalSensor
oneOf.description: Sensor value is reported and user alerted when sensor value becomes critical.

CS_Options_Enable.description: When true, indicates that the sensor input is actively monitored.

CS_Options_ActiveHigh.description: When true, indicates that the sensor input is active when its associated module pin's value is above the digital threshold setting.

CS_Options_Buzz.description: When true, device will sound buzzer when detecting a critical condition for the associated sensor input.

CS_Options_Visual.description: When true, device will display a visual alert when detecting a critical condition for the associated sensor input.

CS_Options_Lockout.description: When true, a critical condition for the associated sensor input will trigger Asset/Truck lockout.

CS_Options_Shutdown.description: When true, a critical condition for the associated sensor input will trigger Asset/Truck shutdown.

CS_Thres.description: Threshold value used to determine if the sensor input is in a critical state.

CS_BuzzDelay.description: Specifies the delay between detection of a critical condition for the associated sensor input and the buzzer sounding.

CS_ReportDelay.description: Specifies the delay between detection of a critical condition for the associated sensor input and the occurrence being logged and reported.

CS_ShutdownDelay.description: Specifies the delay between detection of a critical condition for the associated sensor input and the Asset/Truck being shutdown.

TractionLimpForwardSpeed.title: Traction Limp Forward Speed
TractionLimpForwardSpeed.description: Units: 0.1 kph/bit. Specifies the forward speed limit of the Asset/Truck during Traction Limp Mode.

TractionLimpReverseSpeed.title: Traction Limp Reverse Speed
