BAT2_Therm2nd1.description: Units: 0.125 degree celcuis. Thermistor 1  Secondary board if applicable (300A:03)

BAT2_Therm2nd2.description: Units: 0.125 degree celcuis. Thermistor 2  Secondary board if applicable (300A:04)

BAT2_LTRegen.description: Units: 1kWh/bit. Cumulative Total Battery Regen kWh (300D:01)

BAT2_ChargerFaults.description: Units: 1kWh/bit. Total Number of Charger Faults (300F:01)

BAT2_ChargesNoBal.description: Units: Count. Number of Charges Completed without cell Balancing (300F:02)

BAT2_ChargesNoBalTime.description: Units: Seconds. Timestamp of Last Charge Completed without Cell Balancing (300F:03)

BAT2_ChargesBal.description: Units: Count. Number of Charges Completed with cell Balancing (300F:04)

BAT2_ChargesBalTime.description: Units: Seconds. Timestamp of Last Charge Completed with Cell Balancing (300F:05)

BAT2_RemainingEnergyWarranty.description: Units: 0.125 kWh. Usable Energy remaining for Battery Warranty (kWh) (300C:01)

BAT2_HighTempDerate.description: Units: degrees celcuis. High Temperature Derate Start (C/F)  Discharge (300E:03)

BAT2_LowTempDerate.description: Units: degrees celcuis. Low Temperature Derate Start (C/F)  Discharge. Uses same Thermal Derate bit as High Temperature Derate (300E:04)

BAT2_LiftLockoutStart.description: Units: degrees celcuis. Lift Lockout Start (CSOC%) (300E:05)

BAT3_FullChargeRunTime.description: Units: Seconds. Estimated Current Full Charge Truck Run Time (Seconds) (300F:08)

BAT3_TotalDischargeHours.description: Units: Hours. Lifetime Total Discharge Hours (300F:09)

BAT3_TotalRegenHours.description: Units: Hours. Lifetime Total Regen Hours (300F:0A)

BAT3_LowTempEvents.description: Units: Count. Battery Low Temp Events (Lifetime) (300F:0B)

BAT3_OverTempEvents.description: Units: Count. Battery Over Temp Events (Lifetime) (300F:0C)

BAT3_LowSOCDuration.description: Units: Minutes. Limited Operation Low SOC Duration (Minutes) (300F:0D)

BAT3_LimpHomeEvents.description: Units: Count. Limited Operation Limp Home Events (Lifetime) (300F:0E)

BAT3_LimpHomeDuration.description: Units: Minutes. Limited Operation Limp Home Duration (Minutes) (300F:0F)

BSM_ModuleCount.description: Units: Count. Amount of modules per pack. (2300:03)

BSM_PreChargeRB.description: Units: Status. Readback of the Precharge contactor. Defined values are 0:Open, 1:Closed, 2:Error, 3:N/A. (2300:06)

BSM_ChargeNegRB.description: Units: Status. Readback of the charge negative contactor. Defined values are 0:Open, 1:Closed, 2:Error, 3:N/A. (2300:07)

BSM_ChargePosRB.description: Units: Status. Readback of the charge positive contactor. Defined values are 0:Open, 1:Closed, 2:Error, 3:N/A. (2300:08)

BSM_InverterPosRB.description: Units: Status. Readback of the Inverter positive contactor. Defined values are 0:Open, 1:Closed, 2:Error, 3:N/A. (2300:09)

BSM_AuxPosRB.description: Units: Status. Readback of the aux positive contactor. Defined values are 0:Open, 1:Closed, 2:Error, 3:N/A. (2300:0A)

BSM_PreChargeOut.description: Units: Status. Output of the Precharge contactor. (2300:0B)

BSM_ChargeNegOut.description: Units: Status. Output of the charge negative contactor. (2300:0C)

BSM_ChargePosOut.description: Units: Status. Output of the charge positive contactor. (2300:0D)

BSM_InverterPosOut.description: Units: Status. Output of the Inverter positive contactor. (2300:0E)

BSM_AuxPosOut.description: Units: Status. Output of the aux positive contactor. (2300:0F)

BSM_GFDStatus.description: Units: Status. Status of the GFD. Defined values are 0:NotOK, 1:OK. (2300:16)

BSM_State.description: Units: Status. State of the BSM. Defined values are 0:Uninitialized, 1:Initialization, 2:Initialized, 3:Sleep, 4:Pre-Charge, 5:Pre-Charge Seq, 6:Low SoC, 7:Active, 8:Charge, 9:Sleep Log, 10:Shutdown, 240:Fault. (2300:17)

BSM_HVILStatus.description: Units: Boolean. Status of the HVIL. Defined values are 0:NotOK, 1:OK. (2300:1D)

BSM_PELStatus.description: Units: Boolean. Status of the PEL. Defined values are 0:NotOK, 1:OK. (2300:1E)

BSM_PackCount.description: Units: Count. The number of expected battery packs. (2300:20)

BSM_PackIndex.description: The index of the Battery Pack data provided in this event.

BSM_ModuleIndex.description: The index of the Battery Module data provided in this event.

Tests_Inputs_PinCalibration.description: Test that calibration input pins. Should be run prior to input tests.

Tests_Inputs_RlyClsd12VonRhigh.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyOpen12VonRhigh.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyClsd12VonRlow.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyOpen12VonRlow.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyClsd12VoffRhigh.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyOpen12VoffRhigh.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyClsd12VoffRlow.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_Inputs_RlyOpen12VoffRlow.description: Test that verifies VAM pin inputs and outputs are functioning correctly for a specific combination of outputs.

Tests_ReadPrimarySim.description: Test that verifies internal modem is functional and that the primary SIM is inserted and available.

Tests_ReadSecondarySim.description: Test that verifies internal modem is functional and that the secondary SIM is inserted and available.

Tests_ReadModemImei.description: Test that verifies internal modem is functional and reads its IMEI.

Tests_ReadWiFiMacAddress.description: Test that verifies internal Wi-Fi module is functional and reads its MAC address.

Tests_RTC.description: Test that verifies RTC is ticking correctly.

Tests_CAN.description: Test that verifies both CAN peripherals can send and receive frames successfully.

Tests_GpsAntenna.description: Test that verifies GPS Antenna current detection circuit functions correctly.

Tests_SDCard.description: Test that verifies SD Card is present and functions correctly.

SystemStatus.description: These are important status flags that reflect the state of the system. These statues are retained in NV memory, and thus are not lost after power down.

SystemStatus_Registered.description: When true indicates the device is currently registered to an Asset / Truck within the telemetry system and can freely download configuration updates and upload event data.

SystemStatus_LockedOut.description: When true indicates the Asset / Truck is currently locked out and cannot be used. The Asset / Truck can only be unlocked by a Technician, Supervisor or RME.

SystemStatus_AfterMarket.description: When true indicates the Device was installed as an aftermarket kit (not at time of Truck build), and configured using the AM Baseloader. And thus requires Install Certification through the IVT Tool.

SystemStatus_LockoutVerified.description: When true indicates the lockout has been verified by a Supervisor or RME. Used with the Lockout Verification by RME feature.

SystemStatus_OutOfService.description: When true indicates the Asset / Truck is currently out of service requiring repair by Asset / Truck service vendor. Used with the Lockout Verification by RME feature.

SystemStatus_NotifyVendorPending.description: When true indicates the RME triggered service request to the Asset / Truck vendor has not been sent through the telemetry server. Service request is still pending. Used with the Lockout Verification by RME feature.

LocallyChangedConfig.description: This set of status flags specify when particular configuration has been changed locally and requires synchronisation with the telemetry server. These status flags are retained in NV memory, and thus are not lost after power down.

LocallyChangedConfig_Settings.description: When true indicates setting configuration has been modified locally and requires synchronisation with the telemetry server.

InternalChange_Settings.description: When true indicates setting configuration has been modified internally and settings upload/download will be blocked until session end.

LocallyChangedConfig_OAS.description: When true indicates OAS configuration has been modified locally and requires synchronisation with the telemetry server.

LocallyChangedConfig_TruckConfig.description: When true indicates Truck configuration has been modified locally and requires synchronisation with the telemetry server.

DownloadedConfig.description: This set of status flags specify when a particular configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_Settings.description: When true indicates setting configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_Checklist.description: When true indicates checklist configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_Operators.description: When true indicates operators configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_InputDef.description: When true indicates the input definition has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_EventConfig.description: When true indicates event configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_DisplayText.description: When true indicates PHD Display Text configuration has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_FirmwareMain.description: When true indicates new main firmware has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

DownloadedConfig_FirmwareIo.description: When true indicates new IO firmware has been downloaded from the telemetry server, but has not been applied on the device yet.

InstallVerified.description: This set of status flags indicate whether all installation verification requirements have been satisfied before the device is allowed to be registered/authorized within the telemetry system. These status flags are retained in NV memory, and thus are not lost after power down.

InstallVerified_AssetId.description: When true indicates the current Asset ID field satisfies installation verification requirements.

InstallVerified_Interlock.description: When true indicates the operator has passed all interlock checks satisfying installation verification requirements.

InstallVerified_ConfigUpload.description: When true indicates the device has uploaded its initial configuration to the telemetry server, satisfying installation verification requirements.

InstallVerified_Certified.description: When true indicates the device was installed on a Truck/Asset as an aftermarket telemetry kit install and the install was certified working before the installer left the site, satisfying installation verification requirements.

LastConnect.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of when the device last checked for pending updates or connected to the event upload telemetry server. Can be used for diagnostics as device connectivity status.

LastConnect_EventSync.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of when the last event was uploaded to the telemetry server. Can be used for diagnostics as device connectivity status.

LastConnect_ConfigSync.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of when the device last downloaded or uploaded a configuration update to/from the telemetry server. Can be used for diagnostics as device connectivity status.

TimeZoneOffset.description: Units: seconds offset from UTC. Indicates the current device local time zone as a seconds offset from UTC date and time. This offset is determined from the AssetTimeZone setting factoring in daylight savings.

InstallConfirm.title: Install Confirmation
InstallConfirm.description: Units: Confirmation Bit Field. Indicates the install confirmation boxes as a bit field, at time of install verification.

InstallerName.title: Installer Name
InstallerName.description: Units: string name. Indicates the installer IVT Key used when installing this device on a Truck/Asset as an aftermarket telemetry kit install.

LastChecklist_DateTime.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of the last completed checklist. Used to determine when next to prompt operator for checklist.

LastChecklist_OperatorId.description: Units: Operator ID. Indicates the ID of the operator who last completed a checklist. Used to determine when next to prompt operator for checklist.

LC_DateTimes.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of the last completed checklist. Used to determine when next to prompt operator for checklist.

LC_OperatorIds.description: Units: Operator ID. Indicates the ID of the operator who last completed a checklist. Used to determine when next to prompt operator for checklist.

LastSuccessful_NetworkOperatorId.description: Units: MCC MNC. Indicates the Network Operator ID (as mobile country code, mobile network code, e.g. 50501 for Telstra, 310410 for AT&T) that was last used to successfully transfer data over the cell network.

NetworkOperatorId.description: Units: MCC MNC. Indicates the Network Operator ID (as mobile country code, mobile network code e.g. 50501 for Telstra, 310410 for AT&T) that the device is currently registered to on the cell network.

NetworkAccessTech.description: Units: Access Technology. Indicates the Access Technology of the Cell Network that the device is currently registered to. For example 2 for 2G, 3 for 3G, 4 for 4G.

LastGpsPosition_DateTime.title: Last GPS DateTime
LastGpsPosition_DateTime.description: Units: DateTime in UTC. Indicates the date and time of the last valid GPS position. Used to determine when next to trigger a cold start restart of the GPS module.

LastGpsLat.title: Last GPS Latitude
LastGpsLat.description: Units: 10^-7 deg/bit. Indicates Latitude of the last valid GPS position. Sign indicates cardinal. Negative latitude indicates South. Positive indicates North.

LastGpsLong.title: Last GPS Longitude
LastGpsLong.description: Units: 10^-7 deg/bit. Indicates Longitude of the last valid GPS position. Sign indicates cardinal. Negative Longitude indicates West. Positive indicates East.

OtaFirmwareMain_Slot.description: Units: Memory Slot Index. Indicates the current memory slot the device is storing the current main firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout.

OtaFirmwareMain_Index.description: Units: Segment Index. Indicates the segment index of the current main firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaFirmwareMain_Crc.description: Units: CRC32. Indicates the CRC32 of the current main firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaFirmwareIo_Slot.description: Units: Memory Slot Index. Indicates the current memory slot the device is storing the current IO firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout.

OtaFirmwareIo_Index.description: Units: Segment Index. Indicates the segment index of the current IO firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaFirmwareIo_Crc.description: Units: CRC32. Indicates the CRC32 of the current IO firmware update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaTruckHyz_Index.description: Units: Segment Index. Indicates the segment index of the current HYZ (Truck firmware) update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout.

OtaTruckHyz_Crc.description: Units: CRC32. Indicates the CRC32 of the current HYZ (Truck firmware) update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaTruckCdf_Index.description: Units: Segment Index. Indicates the segment index of the current CDF (Truck configuration) update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout.

OtaTruckCdf_Crc.description: Units: CRC32. Indicates the CRC32 of the current CDF (Truck configuration) update being downloaded from the telemetry server. This field is used for resuming a download after connection dropout. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

OtaTransferStatus.description: Units: OTA Status. Byte 0 indicates the percentage complete of OTA config/firmware file transfer, byte 1 indicate the type of OTA config/firmware file transferred.

ModemSignalStrength.description: Units: dBm. The current signal strength between the device and its connected network.

ModemSignalQuality.description: Units: Percent. The current signal quality between the device and its connected network as a percentage. Where '-1' indicates unknown.

ModemSimpleState.title: Modem Simple State
ModemSimpleState.description: Units: Modem State. The current device modem state simplified for easy diagnosis of telemetry server connection problems.

oneOf.title: Off
oneOf.description: Device's modem is currently off.

oneOf.title: Power On/Off
oneOf.description: Device's modem is in the process of being powered on or powered off.

oneOf.title: Module Setup
oneOf.description: Device's modem is being configured for operation.

oneOf.title: Get SIM ID
oneOf.description: Device's modem is querying connected SIM, based on the current SIM slot settings.

oneOf.title: Network Setup
oneOf.description: Device's modem is being configured for network connection/registration.

oneOf.title: Network Registration
oneOf.description: Device's modem is in the process of registering / connecting to the network.

oneOf.title: Connection Setup
oneOf.description: Device's modem is being configured for telemetry server connection.

oneOf.title: Server Connect
oneOf.description: Device's modem is in the process of connecting to the telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Config Upload
oneOf.description: Device is connected to the telemetry server and is in the process of uploading any local configuration changes.

oneOf.title: Config Download
oneOf.description: Device is connected to the telemetry server and is in the process of downloading any portal triggered configuration changes.

oneOf.title: Time Sync
oneOf.description: Device is connected to the telemetry server and is in the process of synchronising its date and time.

oneOf.title: Event Sync
oneOf.description: Device is connected to the telemetry server and is in the process of uploading locally recorded event data.

oneOf.title: Firmware Update
oneOf.description: Device is connected to the telemetry server and is downloading a portal triggered firmware update.

oneOf.title: Server Disconnect
oneOf.description: Device's modem is in the process of disconnecting from the telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Network Disconnect
oneOf.description: Device's modem is in the process of disconnecting from the network.

oneOf.title: UART Tunnel
oneOf.description: This is a debugging mode to aid diagnosis of an issue. Device is currently setup in a mode that allows direct communication to the device's modem.

oneOf.title: Reserved 1
oneOf.description: Reserved for future use.

oneOf.title: Wait For Call
oneOf.description: This is a test mode. Device is currently setup in a mode that allows communication with a basestation simulator for the purpose of EMC testing.

oneOf.title: Reserved 2
oneOf.description: Reserved for future use.

ModemSimpleError.title: Modem Simple Error
ModemSimpleError.description: Units: Error Code. The last device modem error code simplified for easy diagnosis of telemetry server connection problems.

oneOf.title: No Code
oneOf.description: No code available/present

oneOf.title: Cannot Read SIM
oneOf.description: Device is not able to read SIM from modem. Adjust/Review device's SIM slot settings and if needed insert 3FF SIM into appropriate SIM slot.

oneOf.title: Network Registration Failed
oneOf.description: Device is not able to register on network. Check device's Antenna connection and adjust/review device's network connection settings.

oneOf.title: Network Registration Denied
oneOf.description: Network actively refused connection with device. Check device's Antenna connection and adjust/review device's network connection settings.

oneOf.title: IP Address Assignment Failed
oneOf.description: Device connected to network but was unable to obtain an IP address. Adjust/review device's network connection / data service settings.

oneOf.title: Server Connect Failed
oneOf.description: Device connected to network but failed to connect to telemetry server. Check device's Antenna connection and adjust/review device's telemetry server address settings.

oneOf.title: Server Connect Denied
oneOf.description: Device connected to network but telemetry server actively refused connection with device. Ensure device's install requirements are met (Single pass swipe check complete and device has obtained connected Asset's ID / Serial Number). Adjust/review device's telemetry server address settings and check with telemetry administration staff on the registration status of the device and its connected asset.

oneOf.title: Data Sync Timeout
oneOf.description: Device connected to network and connected to the telemetry server, but connection dropped out part way through synchronisation process. Check antenna signal strength and signal quality readings and check telemetry server connection settings.

oneOf.title: Modem Fault
oneOf.description: Device was not able to perform network registration or server connection due to an internal modem fault. Check modem selection settings, check SIM selection settings, check antenna signal strength and signal quality readings and check telemetry server connection settings.

ModemErrorCode.description: Units: Error Code. The last error code given by the device's telemetry modem. May not necessarily mean a complete telemetry server connection failure. This is the actual error code output by the modem, however an offset may be applied to avoid clashes between codes of different modem types.

ModemConnectionStatus.title: Modem Connection Status
ModemConnectionStatus.description: Units: Connection Status. The telemetry device's current connection status.

oneOf.title: Cell Off
oneOf.description: Modem is currently off and waiting to restart.

oneOf.title: Cell Failed Connection
oneOf.description: Device has failed to connect to telemetry server and has given up.

oneOf.title: Cell Connecting
oneOf.description: Device is trying to connect to server.

oneOf.title: Cell Failed Network
oneOf.description: Trying to connect but failing to join network.

oneOf.title: Cell Failed Server
oneOf.description: Trying to connect but failing to reach telemetry server.

oneOf.title: Cell Connected
oneOf.description: Device is currently communicating with telemetry server.

oneOf.title: WiFi Off
oneOf.description: Modem is currently off and waiting to restart.

oneOf.title: WiFi Failed Connection
oneOf.description: Device has failed to connect to telemetry server and has given up.

oneOf.title: WiFi Connecting
oneOf.description: Device is trying to connect to server.

oneOf.title: WiFi Failed Network
oneOf.description: Trying to connect but failing to join network.

oneOf.title: WiFi Failed Server
oneOf.description: Trying to connect but failing to reach telemetry server.

oneOf.title: WiFi Connected
oneOf.description: Device is currently communicating with telemetry server.

DeviceState.title: Device State
DeviceState.description: Units: Device State. The current internal state of the device, e.g. waiting for ID swipe or shutting down.

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: device current state is unknown

oneOf.title: Wakeup
oneOf.description: device has just woken from sleep / low power mode

oneOf.title: Firmware Update Wake
oneOf.description: device is waiting for IO firmware update

oneOf.title: Init
oneOf.description: device is initialising and loading configuration

oneOf.title: Check Test Mode
oneOf.description: device is currently in test mode

oneOf.title: ID Interlock
oneOf.description: device is currently waiting for operator to Swipe Card or enter Pin Code

oneOf.title: Pre-Start Checklist
oneOf.description: device is currently waiting for operator to complete Pre-Start Checklist

oneOf.title: Seat Belt Interlock
oneOf.description: device is currently waiting for operator to fasten seat belt

oneOf.title: Post Start Checklist
oneOf.description: device is currently waiting for operator to complete Post-Start Checklist

oneOf.title: Run
oneOf.description: device is currently in run mode, Truck/Asset is fully operational

oneOf.title: Shutdown
oneOf.description: device is currently shutting down, Truck/Asset is not operational

oneOf.title: Comms Await Shutdown
oneOf.description: device is currently waiting for telemetry communication to finish before entering low power mode

oneOf.title: Firmware Update Shutdown
oneOf.description: device is updating IO firmware

oneOf.title: Reboot
oneOf.description: device is rebooting

oneOf.title: Sleep Ready
oneOf.description: device is ready for sleep / low power mode

oneOf.title: Sleep
oneOf.description: device is in sleep / low power mode

AssetShutdownTimer_NoKey.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the NoKey Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_KeyOff.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the KeyOff Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_NoOperatorAccess.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the NoOperatorAccess Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_Unattended.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the Unattended Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_NoOperation.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the NoOperation Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_EngineOff.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the EngineOff Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_OperatorLogOff.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the OperatorLogOff Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_Checklist.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before the Checklist Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_Event.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before an Event Shutdown Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

AssetShutdownTimer_ParkBrake.description: Units: Seconds. The current number of seconds remaining before a ParkBrake Shutdown Timeout shuts down the asset. Where -1 indicates the timeout is not enabled or does not currently apply.

VisibleScreens.description: Units: BitField. A BitField containing which screens should be visible on the PHD or FM2 display based on the input configuration in device settings.

VisibleMeters.description: Units: BitField. A BitField containing which meters should be visible on the PHD or FM2 display based on the input configuration in device settings.

LastDisplayScreen.description: Units: Screen enumeration. Specifies an enumeration of the screen displayed last on the FM2 or PHD Display. This allows the display to show this same screen on next start.

SeatBeltStatus.description: This set of status flags for the seat belt interlock and reporting feature.

SeatBeltStatus_Violation.description: When true indicates the seat belt is currently in violation.

SeatBeltStatus_Illegal.description: When true indicates the seat belt is currently illegal and has been fastened in the incorrect sequence.

SeatBeltStatus_Report.description: When true indicates the seat belt is currently being reported as in violation.

OverloadStatus.description: Set of status flags for the overload alert and reporting feature.

OverloadStatus_Overloaded.description: When true indicates the Asset/Truck is currently overloaded.

LastJoin_Ssid.title: Last Joined SSID
LastJoin_Ssid.description: Units: string name. Indicates the SSID of the Wi-Fi network last joined by the device and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

LastJoin_Password.title: Last Joined Password
LastJoin_Password.description: Units: string name. Indicates the password last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

LastJoin_Username.title: Last Joined Username
LastJoin_Username.description: Units: string name. Indicates the username last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

LastJoin_Bssid.title: Last Joined BSSID
LastJoin_Bssid.description: Units: MAC Address as a hexadecimal string. Indicates the Access Point MAC Address last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

LastJoin_EapId.title: Last Joined EAP Identity
LastJoin_EapId.description: Units: string name. Indicates the EAP identity last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transferred data to the Telemetry Server with. Used by PEAP and TTLS to hide the identity of the user while the TLS tunnel is configured.

LastJoin_AuthType.title: Last Joined Authentication Type
LastJoin_AuthType.description: Units: Auth Type. Indicates the authentication type last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

oneOf.title: PEAP
oneOf.description: EAP-PEAP-MSCHAPV2

oneOf.title: TTLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TTLS

oneOf.title: TLS
oneOf.description: EAP-TLS

LastJoin_AuthMode.title: Last Joined Authentication Mode
LastJoin_AuthMode.description: Units: Mode Type. Indicates the Authentication Mode last used by the device to join the Wi-Fi Network and successfully transfered data to the Telemetry Server with.

oneOf.title: Client Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Client Authentication is specified, the telemetry device does NOT authenticate the server.

oneOf.title: Server Mode
oneOf.description: Authentication Mode is only applicable for Authentication types PEAP and EAP-TTLS, where if Server Authentication is specified, the telemetry device requires the server CA certificate to authenticate the server.

BTDevices.title: Bluetooth Paired Devices
BTDevices.description: Units: BT MAC. Indicates the MAC Address of paired bluetooth devices. Paired devices are stored in an ordered list where the most recent used is at the front. Each MAC address is listed across 3 elements of the array (3 fields 2 bytes each). Pair devices are matched with OperatorIDs in the BTOperatorID list.

BTOperatorIDs.title: Bluetooth Paired Device Operator IDs
BTOperatorIDs.description: Units: BT MAC. Indicates the MAC Address of paired bluetooth devices. Paired devices are stored in an ordered list where the most recent used is at the front. Each MAC address is listed across 3 elements of the array (3 fields 2 bytes each). Pair devices are matched with OperatorIDs in the BTOperatorID list.

EventCountDate.description: Units: Days. Day indicator used to determine when to reset the daily event count limits.

EventCountImpact.description: Units: Count. A count of the number of impact events recorded today. Used with the EventLimitImpact setting to limit to total number of impacts recorded per day.

EventCountBasic.description: Units: Count. A count of the number of basic accelerometer activity events recorded today. Used with the EventLimitBasic setting to limit to total number of basic activity events recorded per day.

EventCountDTC.description: Units: Count. A count of the number of dtc events recorded today. Used with the EventLimitDTC setting to limit to total number of Truck DTCs events recorded per day.

LastOutboundId_Settings.title: Last Settings OutboundID
LastOutboundId_Settings.description: Units: outbound ID as string. Indicates the last outbound ID provided by the telemetry server for setting configuration download.

LastVsmSync_SettingsCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the settings configuration in the telemetry device that was last synchronised with the Asset/Truck VSM. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

LastVsmSync_SettingsSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the settings configuration in the telemetry device that was last synchronised with the Asset/Truck VSM.

LastVsmSync_ChecklistCrc.description: Units: CRC32. A CRC32 of the checklist configuration in the telemetry device that was last synchronised with the Asset/Truck VSM. CRC32 is formatted as a unsigned 32bit integer.

LastVsmSync_ChecklistSize.description: Units: Byte Length. Byte length of the checklist configuration in the telemetry device that was last synchronised with the Asset/Truck VSM.
